Reviews.Title: “Will pick a different Hotel next time”
Reviews.Author: Goddessgibson_11
Reviews.Content: I was able to get theis room at a good value on Priceline. BUT I will tell you I switched to the Marriot on Canal Street for the same price and why i did in a bit. Front desk clerk as very fast upon check in.... BEWARE even if the room is prepaid, they will charge you a "resort Fee". Not expected but not that much either. The door man helped me find everything and had wonderful suggestions. There is a coffee shop in the lobby, but it was never open while i was there. This hotel is close to everything from Bourbon Street (if you like that) to the Street Cars. We walked most of the city. THe French Quarter is wonderful and Mothers is a must for lunch. The lobby decor was nice. BUT it had a horible smell that made me ill everytime I walked throgh. Apparently it is supposed to be a pleasent floral scent....... but It was way to strong and I couldnt breath. The room. Small. Nice view of the river and city from the 7th floor. The room was clean and adequate for the one night i stayed there. The bathroom was clean. There is no pool. So these are the reasons I left and walked to the Marriot (WHICH I LOVED). 1. The female desk clerk hit on my 17 year old daughter and made her very uncomfortable. 2. I coulike the smell. 3. I was able to get the Marriot at the exact same price with no resort fee. $70 4. I didnt like the atmosphere for my young children. I personally would not stay here again for the reasons mentioned above. Its a nice little hotel for someone else.

Reviews.Title: “newly Renovated, Friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Jaime Y
Reviews.Content: We chose this Hotel because of the low price. The location was Excellent/Perfect and close to everything! the Staff was very friendly and down to earth. A plus was that the hotel was newly renovated and our room was brand new, and we were the first to go onto the new floor. Once in the room there wasn't much of a view being an interior room, but I didn't stay there to look out of a window. My husband and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy and Cozy”
Reviews.Author: Desiree B
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I thoroughly enjoyed our 2 night stay here. The hotel was spotlessly clean. The 10 floor was completely remodeled, where our room was. The bed was so comfortable. The only thing missing was a refridgerator.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Weekend”
Reviews.Author: cotaylowe
Reviews.Content: Well, the staff at the front desk were really nice. This was my first time in New Orleans--and I was very excited to be so close to the French Quarter that I always hear about. I booked my hotel in March (I thought that was far out enough), but it wasn't. The jazz festival was on the same weekend as my birthday and everything was ALREADY sold out. It was super pricey for this particular reason. $750 for two nights. Plus all the added fees. This hotel was my last resort so I went for it. Our room was very shabby and small. No window. Kind of looked as if it was falling apart. I could go on and on complaining, but I must say when I walked OUTSIDE the hotel, I was happy with where I was. Won't stay here again, and will only go to New 'Awlins when there aren't any HUGE events going on. Still glad that they had that shabby room available for purchase. I had a good birthday. Minus.....well you know! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the Scam in this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nomad221
Reviews.Content: After a few hours in this hotel, the phone at the side of my bed rang. The man on the other end asked me to confirm the room no. which I did. He said his name was David and he was calling from reception. He claimed that when we booked in the computer crashed and he wanted some details. He asked for my name and credit card details. At this point I said I would come down to reception right away. He claimed it was very busy at that moment and that was his reason for calling. I told him I did not give card details over the phone and I would go to reception an hour later. Needless to say I did not. When I eventually went to reception and explained the situation, the receptionist said they were aware of the scam but could not do anything about it claiming it was someone from outside randomly ringing hotel room numbers. It could have been anyone even a staff member. Please beware of this scam. The room itself was small. My husband had to sidle up the side of the bed to get in the space was so narrow. There wasn't a bedside table or light on his side. The carpets were worn and soiled in places. Royal St Charles is a Boutique hotel and has a small coffee shop. There are no lounges to sit in. It is quite centrally located within a 10 minute walk of Bourbon Street. Our room overlooked the street and it was quite noisy being on a tram route.

Reviews.Title: “Valet Parking Charges????”
Reviews.Author: Haley H
Reviews.Content: Be careful that this hotel does not charge you for valet parking that you did not use! Sure the room was OK and somewhat clean in comparison to other hotels in the area, but my husband and I got charged for more than we bargained. Three days after check out, the charge I assumed was a hold, has gone through as $82.85. My husband and I book this hotel through KAYAK so there should be no reason for this charge. When I called the hotel they said the charge was for valet parking (only problem is we did not use valet parking), I left a voicemail with the manager and I am waiting for a response! BE CAREFUL YOU DO NOT GET CHARGED FOR VALET PARKING!

Reviews.Title: “They should honor what they advertise!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lizzy M
Reviews.Content: I just came back from my trip to New Orleans July4th - July 6th. It was a last minute type of deal and I was looking for rates online I got a room for about $100 bucks a night PLUS 50% off valet parking. I THOUGHT I got a good deal went ahead and booked for two nights. I saw that they had an $8.95 resort fee which is fine. That is pretty cheap compared to other hotels Iâ€™ve stayed at before that are $20+. The bad: Upon arrival I had my boyfriend wait outside so I could get us valet parking and check in. I informed the lady at the front desk that my hotel itinerary indicated I would receive 50% off valet parking for BOTH nights. They did not want to honor it even though it clearly stated on my hotel reservation itinerary. She then called a general manager supposedly and said they could ONLY honor it for one night (July 4th) not both. And it just gets worse she told me that the valet parking for the second night (July 5th) would be $40.00 instead of the normal $29.99. I honestly think since they gave me the 50% off for the first night they tried to get their full amount one way or the other and charged me $40.00 for the second night. I don't understand why they would advertise such a false advertisement if they are not going to honor it! If they hadnâ€™t said â€œreceive 50% off valet parking for both nightsâ€� I wouldnâ€™t have mind paying the $29.99 a night. But if something is advertised they should HONOR it. Period. I donâ€™t even know if this hotel has housekeeping because NO ONE ever came to change my sheets, towel, trash NOTHING. I had to call to ask for toilet paper, towels etc. The good: Great location everything is close by. PJâ€™s Coffee shop in their lobby is AMAZING. 2 blocks from Bourbon Street. 4 Blocks from Harrahâ€™s, River Walk etc. Hotel is always cold â€“ just how I like it Rooms are small but comfy! No windows which I didnâ€™t really mind as we came in from the hotel from late nights so we could sleep with no problem.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hoel”
Reviews.Author: petty0720
Reviews.Content: We had a nice experience with the Royal St Charles Hotel. Very Helpful people. Our room was small- we had two beds. The beds were very comfortable with great pillows. We still had room to move around though. The hotel is very close to everything. The only thing negative is the parking garage they use. It is worth the extra 29.00 a day to have the valet parking as the garage is very tight parking. Its an accident waiting to happen. If I go again I will find my own parking place. Our room was very clean and the front desk clerk on days was wonderful about giving info to us. I believe it was the cheapest that was in that area as it is surrounded by more expensive high rise hotels. 1 block from Bourbon Street and Royal Street. Not far from Harrah's also. The trolley was right outside your door.

Reviews.Title: “nice for the price”
Reviews.Author: stacey603
Reviews.Content: Stayed there June 2012. The only complaint is that we failed to request a room w a window. Good location, clean room, very friendly staff all for $100 a night

Reviews.Title: “Great Location with a few downfalls”
Reviews.Author: Soraya0812
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel Father's day weekend and I paid less than $100.00 a night with 1/2 off valet through Hotels.com. The hotel was nice with a cafe in the lobby. The staff was nice and helpful. The pros of this hotel are: close to the French quarter, around the corner from bourbon street, affordable, has valet parking, decent size rooms with wifi. Cons: Charged $9 a day resort fee when I arrived without prior notice, long valet waits when trying to get your car, thin walls I could hear the people in the room next to me, ridiculously cold air in the hotel. All in all I would stay here again because it was so convenient and I could walk everywhere. .

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Glen Head, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Great place for visiting New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Paul F
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel especially if you want to be near the streetcars. Only complaint was the hotel only had a coffee shop but even the pastries there were good. Front desk helped me book a ghost tour and offered suggestions as to where to eat.

Reviews.Title: “All about fees!!”
Reviews.Author: NOLA5152
Reviews.Content: First off at check in we were informed of a "mandatory" $8.95 per night "resort fee". The clerk explained this is for the "business center" (which consists of a card table where the coke machine is), "fitness center (stationary bike and treadmill)...some resort...hotel doesn't even have a pool!!! When we got to our room we discovered there was one one bed which was a double bed. Didn't even know hotels used that size bed anymore! We called down to the front desk to request a room with two beds and were told before they even checked availability that we could get a "rollaway bed" for an additional fee of $10.00 per night. The room was the smallest hotel room I have ever seen. There was not even a window in the room. The carpet in the room and the corridors was soiled terribly and worn. This hotel has a plaque by the door stating it is a "Boutique" hotel. I should say NOT!! This is a two star hotel at best! The only thing this hotel has going for it is the location. Wouldn't stay here again on a bet!!

Reviews.Title: “The most notable thing about this property is how cold it is inside”
Reviews.Author: Brend482
Reviews.Content: The RSC Hotel is very well-situated, just a block from Bourbon Street and the French Quarter and attractions along Canal Street such as the Aquarium, Insectarium and casino. The streetcar runs right past the front of the hotel (this could be a problem if you have trouble sleeping if there is noise outside). There is a coffee and pastry bar in the lobby. The rooms were clean and reasonably furnished. The price was very low as well. What is striking about the RSC is how incredibly cold the air temperature is inside. The A/C is on all the time and it seemed like it could not have been more than 65 in the lobby and hallways (and the room, until we preposterously had to turn on the heat on a day on which it was over 90 degrees outside). It is hard to understand why they keep it so cold inside. The staff was friendly, but was very lacking in knowledge about where things were around the city. You are really on your own for navigation and locating things you need. The rooms are pretty small, with tiny bathroom and no flatscreen TVs. There is a business center with a single computer, and a fitness room, but little else in the way of amenities - this makes the $8.95 "resort fee" rather annoying, as it's not much of a resort. It's definitely not a luxury experience, but if you are looking for an inexpensive and conveniently-located hotel, it's a good selection.

Reviews.Title: “Old School SCAM- Beware of hidden "Mandatory" Fees”
Reviews.Author: Rkelly6190
Reviews.Content: This place is a SCAM BEWARE. I travel literally 200-250 nights year for work and personal and this is a full-on 1970's hidden, mandatory fee SCAM. Whatever you pay for this hotel - amazingly even thru Priceline - you'll get a $8.95 "Resort" seriously RESORT fee for phone, web, SAFE(!!) and biz center fee even if you don't want or need any of those things. Look, I'm a big boy, stayed in a ton of fleabags in New Orleans, literally 2-3 a month as I must travel here for family reasons, done dozens of 2-3 hotels near and in the quarter, NONE have the nerve to charge you a fee that is really just $9 extra extortion fee. So, I guess if you are a frat boy (me too admittedly, dozens of years removed) seeing a cheap price and a close to the Quarter address, please do NOT let them keep doing this to people and just SAY NO. My guess is that they've calculated that us schmucks will just put up with just this amount. Seriously, please don't let them profit from hidden extortion, pass this place up and help all of us that are just trying to save a few dollars while traveling. Thank you and SHAME on the Royal St. Charles and Priceline for allowing this kind of scam to continue.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Thinaeariel
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here on the way to Mississippi, and it was decently priced. Sure, there are closer places to Bourbon St. But this was also a great area, right in the middle of everything we wanted to see! Resort fee was silly, as was 30 dollars a night for valet, but since there's no way I could have navigated parking my car there decently close to us, I guess it was worth it. Also, pretty much every other hotel in the area has the same sort of resort fees and valet parking, some were even more pricey. Everyone was friendly and helpful. Nice exercise room, as well. Room was small with no windows, but If you want to see the area, Go outside! You don't get the experience from watching the world from inside a room. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Aweful Customer Service & Dirty Rooms”
Reviews.Author: butterfly30721
Reviews.Content: During my 4 day stay at the Royal Saint Charles, there was only 3 women at the front desk who were actually nice or helpful in any way. Everyone else there was not friendly or helpful at all. My room looked clean, but when looking closer the walls & doors were dirty, the carpet was stained, the back of my shower curtain had bacteria growing like crazy, the walls in the bathroom were dirty & the mirror was dirty. On top of all this MY GIRLFRIEND HAD HER SUITCASE URINATED IN some time after we left to go to a conference. The manager did not do any thing about it & even tried to blame it on our other friend & myself! I would not stay there agian. This place does not care about practicing good customer service, satisfying their guest nor making anything right when something does go wrong. It is worth it to pay more money to stay else where.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, two blocks from Bourbon St, four from Harrah's. Service was good, cleaning was regular, and the beds were fine. Rooms may be a bit small for some, but hey your only using the room to sleep in. Recommended, will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: bronx_jeep
Reviews.Content: Great location a block away from the French Quarter. Rooms are on the small side, but then again, you don't go to New Orleans to hang out in the hotel room...and there's a deli around the corner as well, and a coffee shop in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Do not waste your money”
Reviews.Author: D E
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very unorganized, unprofessional, and not to mention dated... We did group travel in which they gave away 3 of our rooms to walk-ins. They also gave us the key to the wrong room in which someone was in which was very difficult for us and them. Our room was dusty and the TV did not work. To use the bathroom you most slide between the sink and toliet to close the door because it is so big. The rooms are very small for the prices that they charge. Not to mention that the hotel consist of one drink and vending machine. This hotel is just sad... If it wasn't for our group this trip would have been down hill. Do not stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: Lori A
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel with a great location right on the outskirts of the business district, just a block or two from the chaos of Bourbon St. and the French Quarter. Walking distance to just about everywhere. Rooms are TINY but i don't go on vacation to sit in my room. Clean, tv, and cold air condition is all I need after a long day. It's not a resort so don't expect your mini bar. I dont know what these people want, I've traveled extensively in nice hotels Marriott, Loews, Westin and these places normally do not have mini bars. Also how someone can complain about cold ac is beyond me, especially in a climate like NOLA! Here's a hint it's called a thermostat. If its too cold turn it down. Accomadating front desk helped us organize all our excursions. For the reasonable price we would definitely stay here again next time were in the Big Easy

Reviews.Title: “Rediculous”
Reviews.Author: Samuel M
Reviews.Content: Don't stay here. Terrible service, 3 out of 4 lights in our room do not work, and given the tiny little sheets they give you, and the blastin AC, not having an extra blanket to sleep comfortably is unacceptable. What am I paying this place for if I'm freezing cold while I sleep. Might as well sleep on the streets of new Orleans, you'd be warmer. Avoid this place at all costs. Terrible hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Reasonably Priced”
Reviews.Author: William D
Reviews.Content: You'll find mixed reviews of this hotel on the internet, and I would have to agree. But, all in all, I was very pleased with my stay. I had a corner room on the ninth floor, and it was perfect for my needs. Comfortable bed, great shower, and very quiet (especially for being on the street car line.) I didn't spend much time in the room, so the non-HD TV wasn't an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Trip”
Reviews.Author: Teacheroftigers
Reviews.Content: First, this hotel is within short walking distance of Bourbon Street--right around the corner and lots cheaper than the hotels on Bourbon. It is a tad bit expensive, but it is a nice hotel. The parking is not ideal, as valet is required and your car is parked far away from property. The rooms are nice, but there is no view. The beds are comfortable. There is not a breakfast, but there is a coffee shop (very expensive) in the lobby. The staff is nice. There is some kind of weird recreation fee that I felt was a rip off. Overall, we liked it and would be back.

Reviews.Title: “want to like it”
Reviews.Author: JonieSue
Reviews.Content: This hotel has some good points: great location, friendly staff, fast elevators, good TV, fast internet, good AC. However, the rooms are just too small. Our first room was ridiculous. The second room reeked of cigarette smoke. Our third room was better, but still small. The exercise bike was broken, the computer in the office did not allow log in to secure sites. There was an $8.95 charge for internet and fitness center, too. Everything in all three rooms was just worn out--broken drawers, delaminating cabinets etc. They say they are refurbishing, but I would wait. Also, about 1/4 of the rooms have no windows at all, fine if you plan to party all night and sleep all day. Fortunately, we were not in the room much. PS Since there was no password for the internet, I am guessing you could decline the fee and login anyway. Don't pay for the fitness center The public space is a coffee shop, very industrial

Reviews.Title: “I'll never know”
Reviews.Author: Meaz2827
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation online for four rooms, 3 nights each. Once confirmed, I needed to make a change, so I called them. And got voicemail. During the middle of the business day. So I left a message. I also sent an email asking them to call me back. Nothing. Next day, same deal. Voice mail, email, no response. I sent a 3rd email and left a 3rd voicemail. My final email was a cancellation of the reservation. We were prepared to dump a couple of grand on this weekend at this hotel. We will be staying somewhere else. Note below says I travelled in May 2012 because the website requires the field. Never travelled.

Reviews.Title: “Small Room High Price”
Reviews.Author: Lawrence W
Reviews.Content: We stayed during the Jazz Fest so the room were high anyway. However, for the size and amenities of the room, it was way over prices. Besides one small desk chair and the bed, there was no place to sit. The bathroom was very small with little counter space. We were on the 5th floor and the street noise was a big problem at all hours of the night. Granted, we weren't in the room that much but we hated every minute of it when we were. Parking is always a problem in NOLA but this hotel has no parking garage and the garage they use is over a block away and very hard to get in and out of.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, but hotel has a "resort" fee”
Reviews.Author: Camila F
Reviews.Content: First of all, that "resort fee" seems like such a scam, I don't get it, I thought it was abusive. And it was also abusive how the price went so high over the days, which made us stay there for only two nights instead of three. But besides that, staff was really nice and, even though we had a room without a view (only two small windows on top of the wall), it was really nice and big, comfortable bed. Hotel really close to all the action, a short walk to Bourbon street.

Reviews.Title: “Event weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: bamatravelers08
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel in August 2011 for the Final Four in March 2012. The price had been inflated, but all New Orleans hotels did the same. It was in a good location near the French Quarter, casino, and Superdome. It is in need of some decorating help. We were on the 2 nd floor, street side, and it was noisy. Some friends were higher up and said it was not. We had a balcony which was nice. The lighting was dim, especially in the bathroom. All in all, for an event weekend, it was serviceable. I would not stay there again. Also, there is a mandatory $8.95 package to get WiFi. There is a streetcar stop at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Mandatory Value Package”
Reviews.Author: John L
Reviews.Content: The hotel is only decent, although the location adjacent to the French Quarter and on a trolley line is convenient. The rooms are small and nothing special. Beware that they charge a mandatory "value added package" of $8.95 per night for things that should be complimentary (long distance, wi-fi, and access to the business center (a super-slow computer) and fitness center) - whether you use them or not.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: LeeConcord_CA
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at this hotel. The first time was in 2004. Since then, the hotel has been renovated. I love that the trolley stop is right outside the door if you want to head to the Garden District area. There is another trolley stop right around the corner for heading to the cemetery district. Canal St. which heads to the French Quarter is 1 block over from the hotel. The hotel staff, from maid service to the front desk, were so incredibly friendly and helpful. Every person I dealt with seemed to truly enjoy making our stay a great one. Tamara at the front desk, and Danielle, housekeeping, were particularly helpful. If I visit New Orleans again, I will DEFINITELY chose to stay at the Royal St. Charles again.

Reviews.Title: “One night stay during the Final Four”
Reviews.Author: gvillemama
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Royal St. Charles on Friday, March 30 before the Final Four. We arrived around 6 p.m. and had no problems whatsoever getting the valet service and check-in taken care of. Hotels in the Quarter were limited because of the Final Four, but we were able to book this one and an attractive rate. It was a queen room with no window, which was kind of disappointing but in reality, we spent every hour outside of the room except when we were sleeping. It was not excessively noisy, it was in a good location and everyone was extremely helpful as well as friendly. I would most definitely stay here again on a return trip to New Orleans, but would be sure to request a room with a window.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean, will consider returning”
Reviews.Author: Serendipity197532
Reviews.Content: We booked this room on Priceline over a month in advance. After booking, we called to request 2 double beds because we were traveling with another couple. We were told "no problem." We called a day prior and again were told our request would be granted. Upon arrival, we were informed only a king bed was available. Unfortunately, four 30-something adults had to pile up in the bed after a long night of drinking. But being in New Orleans, we found humor in it and got past it fairly quickly. The location is great. Make sure you don't pass it when arriving. As soon as you turn the corner and see the orange cones, pull to the siide, otherwise you will be making a block (which takes forever). The room was very small but clean. Linens were soft. No mold or mildew, however the shower leaked terribly from underneath (I hope the floor below didn't leak). Initially everyone blamed my being drunk of drenching the floor with water until they all took showers and realized it was actually the shower leaking. There is a mandatory $8/night fee the hotel charges, which is not advertised anywhere. Although we all had cell phones with internet, it is required, which is just another way for them to get additional money. Valet is about $30/night. Be sure to call ahead because it takes about 30 minutes to get your car. There is a nice coffee shop in the lobby. Overall this hotel is what you make of it. Not a 5 star but definitely not Motel 6. I don't really have any complaints especially since New Orleans appeared to be sold out this weekend and I had to go down to a 2 1/2 star rating - I'd give this hotel at least a 3 star.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Everett04
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after we got back from our cruise. The hotel and rooms were clean. The staff was helpful and friendly. They charge you an automatic $8 service fee for long distance calls an wifi. So my wife and I both called our families back in Canada. Overall nice hotel and would return.

Reviews.Title: “close to the action”
Reviews.Author: kenn081
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ok the best part about it is that you are a block away from the French quarters and all the action. also very close to resturants and transportation the trolly stops out front and taxis come by all of the time. also the help at the hotel was very prompt in getting you what you need like towels or extra pillows etc...

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price”
Reviews.Author: grandma8206
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews I was a little concerned about staying here. We really enjoyed our stay here. The price was great and It is a great location one block from Canal Street and the French Quarter. We were very happy with the accommodations. Our room was not huge but was very clean and comfortable. I can't say enough about the staff. Everyone was so friendly and helpful. They recommended and then arranged great tours for us. We had a small problem with the air conditioning in our room. We went out for breakfast and when we returned, they already had the problem fixed. We would definately stay here again. Our only problem was the inconsiderate younger people staying there who were slamming doors and yelling back and forth to their friends in the hallways between 2:00 and 5:30 am.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: DaveBOttawa
Reviews.Content: I found many of the reviews somewhat perplexing after staying here for 5 nights leisure. It delivers exactly what I expected and anticipated for the price range. It's not the Ritz but we were not paying Ritz prices. It's clean and reasonably maintained. A three minute walk from the French Quarter without the constant noise of Bourbon Street. Rooms were small but comfortable. I had to wonder if some of the reviews were expecting champagne service for beer prices. We are as picky as anyone about cleanliness and basic service and I would return here in a flash.

Reviews.Title: “Way too small....way over priced”
Reviews.Author: Slyfox75
Reviews.Content: Room is tee-nincy. Not event a counter top in bathroom. Bed up against wall so u have to climb over to get out of bed Carpet nasty...... Vacuumed but just ragged out! Valet is 29 a day...... No place to pull in for valet so u are rushed to get out. Tube tv. Makeshift closet is too shallow to fit a hang up bags width! I've stayed in 4-5 hotels in new Orleans this is worst value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, but internet fee is imposed!”
Reviews.Author: MRomerodCorzo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Royal St. Charles hotel from February 28th - March 3rd for a business trip. It was a very pleasant stay. The room was small but very comfortable. The room was well mantained, the bathroom was clean and they provided more than enough towels (which may not happen at most hotels). The hotel is well located (one block from Canal Street, three blocks from Bourbon Street and the Street Car stops at the corner). The only thing we didn't like is that you have to pay a daily extra fee of $8.95 for the wireless internet service, which increases the price per night. The hotel staff was very helpful and nice. The hair dryer in our room was broken and they changed very quickly. There are a lot of stores and restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience - Rock n Roll Marathon Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Renee F
Reviews.Content: We signed up to run in the New Orleans race October 2011 after running in the St. Louis Rock n Roll race. My son did the search and located this hotel for us and when we arrived we were so pleased!!! The location was perfect!! There were 8 of us on this trip. We booked Deluxe Queen rooms and we were on the 8th floor. Our rooms were very nice and we had a full size window that overlooked the street. Noise from the outside was very minimal and when you go to New Orleans and stay downtown...you are going to hear the sounds of the street and that's what it's all about!!! The bathroom was very nice too. Very spacious and clean. The room had a full length closet, a desk w/chair, a TV, drawers for clothes, ironing board, coffee pot and another area to store luggage. There was plenty of floor space. We never felt cramped or crowded at any time during our stay. The 2 queen beds were very comfortable. The maid servous was very good...we never wanted for anything. We used the valet parking the entire time we were there and when we called down to get our car they had it downstairs waiting on us before we exited the elevators. We used our car once while we were there and it was so nice not to have to worry about it. The location of the hotel was perfect. We were able to walk everywhere we wanted to go. The Convention Center, River Walk, Bourbon Street, French Quarter...all within walking distance. The weather was perfect for walking. The front desk was also amazing! From the moment we checked in on Friday to check out on Monday they were friendly, smiling, and asking about our visit and how the race went. They answered all of our questions and were happy to have us there. The price was also very reasonable...especially with so much going on that weekend in the city. It was just an overall wonderful experience. We've told all of our friends about our experience and we are already planning our trip for the 2013 Rock n Roll New Orleans Marathon. The Royal St. Charles Hotel will be where we stay for sure!!!

Reviews.Title: “Royal St Charles Hotel for Rock n Roll Marathon Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Pam B
Reviews.Content: We booked the RSC through their website to be close to friends who were also down for the Marathon. The room we were in was 7th floor and a Deluxe Queen. Since the marathon was on Sunday, we came down on Friday and stayed until Monday. Lobby was nice and clean as was the elevators (4 of them). What we didn't know was that Queen rooms are interior to the hotel and there was a regular size faux window with nice curtains. The glass blocks used to make the window allowed in some light (must have been from a skylight or nigh light) during the day. At first I was a little claustrophobic since the room was small and I wasn't used to not at least having a window in a hotel room. Front desk was understanding, however the hotel was booked solid for the weekend, but they would try to work us into an exterior room. Room was small (but there was only 2 of us)..smallest hotel room I've ever stayed in. Queen size bed was against the wall on one side so who ever slept there either had to crawl over of shimmy off the end of the bed. Just don't run into the desk when you do it in the middle of the night. After the first night we decided the room was sufficient since we wouldn't be staying in the room much except to sleep. Firm bed, nice sheets, heavy down comforter, and nice pillows...we slept like babies! (I have back pain if the beds are too soft..no back pain for the whole weekend!) Friends stayed on the second floor where they had a balcony. Room was same size as ours but with a king size bed. After the first night they were dreading it since street noise was a big problem even with ear plugs. We used the valet parking since the parking area was a couple blocks away at another hotel. From past experience I've learned that if a hotel offers valet parking it a good bet you want to use theirs instead of risking parking on the street. Car didn't move much and no dings or scratches. Bathroom had a tub/shower, toilet and small vanity. Plenty of ventilation when you turn on the light as I thought it was going to suck up the towels too! No risk of fogging up the mirror in this room. There was a hair dryer, soaps, lotion and shampoo. Plenty of towels and when we called down for more they were there in less than 5 minutes. The coffee shop wasn't open the morning of the Marathon, but it did open later that morning. It would have been nice to have had a muffin and coffee, but hopefully they will get the hint and open next time. Hotel is close to Bourbon St and Royal St... street cars are close and we walked everywhere! We look forward to another visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant experience”
Reviews.Author: SandiLand56
Reviews.Content: We were there for Mardi Gras. Front Desk was friendly and helpful. Bellman was great! Housekeeping very accomodating. Room was clean and comfortable. We will be looking forward to our next stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: Leslie B
Reviews.Content: Located not far from Bourbon Street and the weekend after Mardi Gras, we didn't expect it to be a five star hotel but we did expect to be able to sleep there. First a double room is one double bed and a hide-a-way double bed not to beds. Second we had to remove the mattress from the hide-a-way and put it on the floor to sleep on it. The hidges were ducktaped together! The mattress wounldn't even tuck all the way back in the frame. When we let management know about it their response was "we know".

Reviews.Title: “So Accomodating..Never met a staff like them”
Reviews.Author: Lasarre
Reviews.Content: We checked into the Royal St. Charles hotel and the computers were slow. They apologized profusely about it and were so nice. It didn't bother me. It happens. We were taken to our rooms. One was really small and the other had a door attached to some room making a lot of noise. I called the front desk and they said they would change our rooms immediately. They had to change both of our rooms because I wanted my daughter by me. The maintenance manager came up and asked if we would like to see the other rooms before moving. Much better! The rooms have a little bit of a musty smell and the carpets could be a little cleaner, but with the location and for the price, $60 on Priceline, I am not complaining. I decided to extend our stay for one night and ended up with a huge confusion with Priceline. In the end, they told me the hotel would charge me $158 cancellation fee because Priceline put down the same night I already had a room. I called the front desk and Carolina was there. She is a jewel. She spent over an hour on the phone with Priceline sorting out the mess. She said she wanted to update the reservation right away so there wouldn't be confusion later in the week and it was all taken care of. Also, Ernie, the valet is fantastic. He is so friendly and helpful. We tried to give him a tip and he's like no you are paying for valet, you don't need to pay me extra. It's like the staff can't do enough to make your stay a great one. I would definitely stay here again. The location and the staff can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from the Royal St. Charles”
Reviews.Author: Christina W
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for an entire week during a family reunion in New Orleans. Nearly every staff member I encountered was rude and none of them were helpful. Our bed had no blanket and when we asked for one the desk clerk told us that they did not keep spare blankets. The second day we were there the hot water went out. We called every day and it stayed out for 5 out of the 7 days we stayed at the hotel. My husband and I also were in a room right at the corner of St. Charles Ave and all night long could hear the street cars pass. It sounded like someone dragging a dumpster down the street. The location of the hotel to the street car is extremely convenient but the rooms need to be better insulated. If your guests can't sleep what's the point?! Also, i was charged a very different amount then was agreed upon and when I tried to use the so called computer facility there was only one ancient computer and the printer wouldn't work. I asked the front desk for five days to have it fixed so I could prove I was being over charged to no avail. I finally got very angry and called every 10 minutes to remind them it wasn't working before they finally sent someone up (apparently he was on grounds all along!) to fix it. Even after I showed them the price I was quoted and HAD ALREADY PAID, they said that I would not refunded the additional "fees" I was charged upon arrival, even though the amount I had previously paid included taxes and fees. I had a wonderful time visiting my family and my husband had a good first visit to N.O. but we left angry and feeling ripped off by this no good hotel. Stay elsewhere for your own sake! Oh, by the way the so called continental breakfast was a joke. Most of my family stayed in the Convention Center Marriott and they absolutely loved it. I wish I had too.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, bad anemities”
Reviews.Author: Sarah B
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 days during mardi gras. paid 259 per night for a very small room with no fridge, microwave, radio/alarm clock, no free breakfast. there was a coffee shop inside the hotel. the location was the best part. all the parades went by st charles. When i made the reservation 3 months in advance i reqested a balcony room. when i went to check in, they said the balcony rooms were sold out 3 days ago. Great location for mardi gras and the cheapest one i found near the french qtr. french qtr is just 2 blocks away!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: JulieWa
Reviews.Content: the room was just okay. Nothing fancy but that was okay with us since we spent very lil time in the room anyway. Just minutes from Bourbon St, on the parade routes which was really cool, and easy access to the trolleys. Valet parking was NOT free, $29 a day. They charge an $8.25 room fee for unlimited local, long-distance calls & wi-fi which I think is ridiculous since mostly anyone with a cell phone does not need. All in all we'd definitely stay there again but will fly next time. We absolutely did not need a car to get around the city.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: Anne C
Reviews.Content: Incompetent staff, tiny bathroom, no fridge or microwave in room, run-down exercise area, parking is 2 blocks away and there is no room service.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Customer Service Award”
Reviews.Author: FPepoon
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is lovely, and it is in a great location, but I would never stay there again based on customer service alone. It all started with a booking problem at the New Orleans Boutique Hotels website. I called several times during business hours only to get a "please call during business hours or leave a message" recording. Repeated messages were left and I never got a call back. Hotel staff were unconcerned with making a good impression on guests, and left one with the feeling that anyone other than a New Orleans native was not welcome at the hotel. With customer service like this, it is hard to imagine how this hotel group stays in business at all.

Reviews.Title: “Good Trip”
Reviews.Author: Jason F
Reviews.Content: Purchased a room on Hotwire and was given this hotel. I read the reviews on this website and was not expecting much. We had a late check and nice greeting from the valet and front desk. Got to our room and it was very nice on the 2nd floor. It had a balcony which was very nice. The bed was great! The room was clean and the staff was cordial. Not sure why so many low or bad reviews on this hotel but we had a great stay. It is a 3 star and that is exactly what to expect from here. I will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Karen S
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a 4-day visit based on the fact that it calls itself a "boutique hotel". We booked a "Superior 1 Queen-1 Queen Bed-Wifi-Iron-Handmadefurniture-Coffee Maker-Safe-Hairdryer" room through Priceline. What we got was clearly an INFERIOR DOUBLE with cheap furniture. Our room was nothing like the hotel's website described. When we asked about it, we were told there had been some water damage on other floors and we could possibly change to a Queen room the next day. We had to ask...the front desk staff did not inform us of this as check in. The amenities fee that was optional on the website, became "mandatory" at check in, so add $8.95 a night to your stay. The friendliness of the staff? Fuggetaboutit! The only positive thing I can say about the Royal St. Charles is the location. New Orleans again? YES! Royal St. Charles? ABSOLUTELY NOT!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for location.”
Reviews.Author: MsFliz
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through hotwire's secret hotels. For the price the room was perfect. Small room but clean and the hotel offered valet parking, in room safe, in room coffee, & wifi(for a mandatory daily charge). Would stay here again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SaltMeatHead
Reviews.Content: Very nice clean hotel, our room was large with 2 beds and nice big bathroom. The parking attendants could use some geritol, takes a while to get your car, the receptionist were nice.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap”
Reviews.Author: OZZY872
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Royal Saint Charles at end of December, we stayed there because it was cheap compared to other hotels and its close to the French Quater, about a block away, rooms are not the cleanest and very small. But when you are in New Orleans you dont spend alot of time i your room, just a place to crash after wild nights on Bourbon St. Wouls stay there again for the price but dont expect luxury. Oh there is a $8.95 fee you are charged a day that nobody will tell you about, so be aware and parking will cost you about $30.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Reception”
Reviews.Author: Britkim2169
Reviews.Content: Receptionist didn't look me in the eye once while I was checking in - she was much more interested in checking her Facebook on her phone - Ignored me for a full minute or two while she conducted her social life!!!! Room was dingy and depressing and we had to call maintenance to clear the blocked toilet - lovely!! He (the maintenance man) was, however, very friendly, very apologetic and the highlight of our hotel stay - never thought I would say that!!!!! Thankfully we had a great evening on Bourbon Street!!!

Reviews.Title: “Security”
Reviews.Author: ickyvic
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights in Dec. The location was good but that was all that went right! Have two other issues and at this time Managment has yet to respond, even after making a report to NOLA police department. I WONT STAY THERE AGAIN !!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Located!”
Reviews.Author: DK_FLOrlando
Reviews.Content: This was a cool hotel but in a perfect location and the St. Charles street car has a stop directly in front of the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: rallen043
Reviews.Content: I booked this room in advance and needed to cancel, as I can no longer make the trip. I attemted to cancel a couple days before the deadline by calling the number given in the confirmation email multiple times throught the evening. Nobody ever answered. I left a message to cancel, then called throughout the next day without any luck. I left another message. Later that night my card was charged for the entire stay. I have now left another message and sent an email. Maybe this will finally get their attention. Be warned- only book if you are 100% sure your plans won't change.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: alwayz_on_vacation
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent 3 nights at the Royal St. Charles. We arrived late on Friday 12/2/11 and had a friendly, quick check in. The hotel is in a great location just a few blocks from the casino, Bourbon Street, bars, restaurants, aquarium, insectarium, etc, etc. Our room was a corner room on the 9th floor with one full wall of windows facing St. Charles Avenue and even a view of the river in the distance and another half wall of windows providing allot of light, a view of the streetcar, etc. The room was fairly large, however, allot of wasted space due to the huge hallway into the room. The bathroom was probably the smallest I have ever seen, however, the main part of the room was sufficient with king bed, desk, armoire/tv, etc. The bed was very comfortable. There was a coffee pot (PJ's coffee shop down in the lobby too). There was also a safe in the room, although, ours showed an error message when we checked so we called the front desk and someone was up to clear it in a matter of minutes. The cons: The carpet was quite worn and dirty and the room pretty noisy due to the street cars and traffic, however, the noise did not bother us at all but I could see it bothering some. We booked through expedia and got a super cheap rate. We travel to New Orleans quite often and have stayed at several other hotels including the Royal Sonesta, Iberville, Sheraton, St. Louis, Ambassador, etc. For the right price, we would definitely stay at the Royal St. Charles again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: jwharris
Reviews.Content: Staff was very friendly and provided great service. Room was a little small but perfect for us. Located steps away from the French Quarter, but in a quieter area. Great purchase! Will definiately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!!”
Reviews.Author: TerryTH
Reviews.Content: Fun time outstanding staff clean well maintained room.

Reviews.Title: “yuk! as a matter of fact, double yuk!!”
Reviews.Author: Lunacy1952
Reviews.Content: very very down in the heels. very very ugly. this is the last time i let my husband make the hotel reservations! he was trying to save money i guess. hoping we didn't bring a suitcase of bed bugs back with us. i am in the process of carefully washing every item that we had with us in the room as i write this. bell boy was very nice if i have to say something positive. upon getting there was informed there is a $9 "telephone/ internet/ fitness center" per night extra surcharge. What?!!! that was the very first time we had heard of that charge!! no mention when booking room. rooms are the size of large closets so be prepared.

Reviews.Title: “Don't check in at night!!”
Reviews.Author: brett h
Reviews.Content: On a recent trip and first time to New Orleans I had the unfortunate opportunity to meet Greg the front desk attendant. A month prior I had booked a room with a King bed and had called 3 days before arriving to confirm my reservation. When I arrived I was told that they only had one room left and it was a double. After pleading my case, I was told that I could take the room or go to another property. I asked for the MOD (manager on duty) and was told that there wasn't one. I was surprised since I had worked in the hotel industry and had never been in one of that size without a MOD. He said and I quote "I bet you 20 dollars that the hotel across the street doesn't have one either" as he pointed to the Marriott. I simply laughed and said ok...that's enough, lets just stop talking. He said you don't tell me to stop talking " I'm a grown assed man!". This is the front desk mind you. I was shocked. He kept on arguing and I had to step outside of the building to make a phone call before it went further. I would NEVER expect anyone who is supposed to be representing a property to behave the way Greg did. I would NOT stay at this hotel in the future nor recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Place, Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: Marie044
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to book the montoleone hotel but was advised the RSCH was on par and just as good..........Not so... I stay in a lot of hotels and this one was probably the worst I have ever stayed in. The staff are rude the rooms dirty and I did not know what the awful smell was but it was so bad, We were there for 2 nights and I could not wait for morning to come to get out of there....

Reviews.Title: “Terrible in every way”
Reviews.Author: kb0t
Reviews.Content: This was one of the worst hotels I've ever stayed in. The only redeeming quality was that it was clean. Everything else was a nightmare. The front desk staff is rude and unorganized. We waited at least 30 minutes while the staff was only helping one group of customers. When finished, she never looked at us to ask if we had been helped. Another 20 minutes it took to get us checked in. Once we got to our room I noticed that a) we were in a room in the middle of the hotel with no widow! what hotel has no window? Thankfully, they made a fake window out of glass tiles and drapes. Real nice touch. And b) there was a loud constant humming noise coming from the ceiling. I immediately called the front desk. After my 4th attempt to get through, they finally answered and cut me off before I could finish asking to be moved to another room. Supposedly they were booked for the weekend. They never honored the sign in the bathroom that suggested that you keep your towels on the rack to save water. Every day we had new towels. The alarm clock broke. The humming/buzzing noise happened all weekend. The only thing we could do was turn on the fan in the bathroom to drown out the noise at night. The entire hotel lost hot water in the middle of the day on Saturday - when I was trying to get ready for a wedding). When someone in my party complained, the front desk never apologized, but blamed it on the City. We were also charged a mandatory $7.95 per day. It was for wifi, unlimited local calls, and gym use. Things that I never used, nor intended to. But it was mandatory. Upsetting to say the least. Despite all of this, the most frustrating aspect is the attitude of those at the front desk. Very unhelpful and unapologetic. Terrible terrible experience.

Reviews.Title: “Never staying here again”
Reviews.Author: Tabatha B
Reviews.Content: I had picked this hotel for the location close to the French Quarter, and the reasonable price. First of all the parking, even for having valet parking, was terribly inconvenient. The help was not only unfriendly, but down right cold and unhelpful. We had booked a non-smoking king room, but when we got to the room we noticed that it was clearly marked for smoking and the rooms beside us were marked nonsmoking. When the issue was addressed with the front desk they simply replied that they do not allow smoking in any room. I don't see why I would pay for for a non-smoking room if they don't allow smoking period. That issue was never resolved. I was very disappointed to find the hotel very dirty and the rooms were so small you could barely move around freely in them. They also have absolutely no vending machines for drinks, but they did have one inconveniently located on the first floor for snacks. Over all the hotel room was dirty, smelly, the ac/heat and water for the shower was never consistent, and it was just a very unpleasant stay for us. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Name the excuse and they have it...”
Reviews.Author: J W
Reviews.Content: When you walk into the lobby and find 2 groups of irate customers and Jessica the front desk clerk asking you to wait while she deals with a crisis: RUN! We waited 30 minutes and finally joined the commotion after elevator upon elevator of college kids run amok in the lobby. After an hour we learn our reservation for 2 nights (double beds) were not going to be honored because they had no more double beds. These were given to the college kids. Our first option was to stay at a sister location (The Ambassador Hotel) for 1 night and come back to figure it out the following day...but we needed 2 nights. After Jessica called Laurie (the GM) 3 or 4 times, she informs us Laurie is on the way down. Also...we were told we should have specified a room number. Ummm, what hotel requires a room number in order to honor a reservation? After receiving an update on the situation, Laurie talks to my group to "help us ladies". That's double-speak for - I can put you in the Sheraton Hotel for $195/night: NO! Why should we pay for their mistake? Then she says she has 4, 6 or 7 rooms with Queen sized beds in them (the number of rooms was a moving target). We said we will take 2 rooms at the rate on our reservation. She tells us she will split the rate with us: NO! Why should we pay for their mistake? By now we must've been in the lobby for over 3 hours and Laurie constantly lied, tried to blame Jessica, gave us the Regional Director's name and number, and told us of her 20 years of hotel experience. Then MAGICALLY 2 nights were available at The Ambassador Hotel. During this entire ordeal neither Jessica or Laurie offered an apology just blame. To make matters worse - we witnessed a couple of older women (who were already in the hotel for a few nights) get locked out of their room and told there was no record of them. Apparently they gave their room to one of the other groups, who were decent enough to inform Jessica the room was occuppied. Things were better at The Ambassador where the front desk clerk IMMEDIATELY apologized for our ordeal and Richie the Regional Director rectified the problems encountered the following day.

Reviews.Title: “very upset and dissappointed”
Reviews.Author: schafftiffany
Reviews.Content: We booked this reservation in well enough time to make sure we would have a place to stay for our friends 30th birthday party. Actually I booked it on September 18th through dhr.com.. There was a few of us that booked the rooms through this site and at the same place. On the morning of Oct 22nd, we valeted at the Royal St. Charles because we knew it was where we were going to be sleeping. We had several things planned like the breast cancer run in city park, and the french quarter before we could check in. They took our vehicle and asked us about our reservations acknowledging our stay at the Royal St. Charles. After we completed what was suppose to be done during the day, we went to check in and the lady at the front desk told us there was no rooms available for my husband and I. Now at this point my husband and I have been drinking all day and they are telling us that we can't stay there. We are gonna have to leave to go to another hotel. Not only did they do it to us but to our friends right after. The reason told to us was due to DHR site overbooking and not having the correct amount of rooms available. Also there was a younger girl that came in after us... crying to them and gave her a room, but there was no more rooms available for us. I'm furious they made us go through all this about our room. They were making up there own rules as they went along. The manager was not present and we were told to we needed to wait until Monday. I'm assuming the managers name is Laurie. Monday wasn't going to do good for us. We needed her there then. How do you not have someone in charge on a busy weekend. I find it very hard to believe. Our birthday friend had a room Friday and Saturday night. He had purchased a 60 dollar cake. We were suppose to celebrate with them at the royal St. Charles which never happened because of the switch of plans. The reason for all of staying at the hotel was for us to not drink and drive. I have two children at home which I never get to have a night away and had this planned.They said yall always get overbook and it happens almost every weekend through 3rd party sites. I would appreciate if someone would contact me about this matter. The only thing I was pleased about was the bell guy who drove our vehicle to another hotel so we did not have to drink and drive. This really ruined everyones plans and caused other to drive home 40 minutes away. I'm furious.

Reviews.Title: “just okay”
Reviews.Author: crystal g
Reviews.Content: the valet was friendly and helpful but I wish I could say the same for the front desk. We had problems when we arrived with our reservations. There was still soap on the shower wall left by the last guest, so the bathroom wasn't cleaned or it was a rush job. If you are not planning on spending too much time in your room, this is a great deal for the location. Nothing special and it really doesn't have that old new orleans charm that other hotels take pride in having.

Reviews.Title: “Your reservation might not be honored.”
Reviews.Author: SassyToursist
Reviews.Content: This hotel should be added to the New Orleans "ghost tour,"as there is some sort of supernatural force snatching reservations. Our last night in the hotel we heard screaming as we entered the hotel lobby. The reservation ghost had struck again and some poor woman was screaming in horror as she learned her reservation was snatched. The hotel staff blamed "expedia," for,"overbooking," but clearly its an angry ghost! Be warned this filthy hotel may not honor your reservation. For us it was just the wrong type of room, but the screaming woman above wasnt given a room at all.... The hotel management has questionable business ethics. queen and crescent is the same owners haunted by the same reservation snatching ghost! Be ware!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Good Service, Some Minor Cleanliness Issues”
Reviews.Author: Kensomo
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel through a Groupon offer that included half price valet parking and tickets to a swamp tour. The hotel is conveniently located on the St. Charles Streetcar route and is within walking distance of the French Quarter. It is an interesting building that housed a bank for many years. Our room was small but comfortable. Three magazine describing events, places of interest and restaurants were on the desk. The lobby also had a table with travel information and discount coupons. We are very familiar with New Orleans but had we been first time visitors, this information would have been excellent to read. The bathroom was disability equipped with solid supports around the toilet and shower/bath. A pull down seat in the shower/tub aided accessibility. While I do not require wheelchair access, the hotel clerk told me that wheelchair accessible rooms are available. My only negative impression is that the rug in our room really needed to be cleaned or replaced. There were several large and smaller stains visible on it. Not a room where we felt comfortable walking barefoot ! We would have rated the hotel higher if the rug was clean. Although we were on the 6th floor, the noise from the street reached our room. It was mildly disturbing throughout the night to my partner. Our floor had an ice machine hidden away in a closet but no vending machines for beverages. There is a PJs Coffee House in the lobby but it closes early in the evening. There are several good restaurants within walking distance. The valet parking offer extended until 3PM which gave us extra time to take a ride on the streetcar without worrying about reparking our car after the noon check-out. The valet staff were friendly and courteous.The desk staff were friendly and helpful. They booked the swamp tour for us, recommended nearby restaurants and told us about the all day streetcar pass. Overall, we enjoyed our stay especially for the discounted Groupon price.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service, bait and switch?”
Reviews.Author: Deakak
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through hotels.com. We have stayed here before and liked how close it is to the French Quarter ( for a reasonable price too). We were emailed confirmations from hotels.com and my wife called the hotel to confirm a few days before our trip as well. When we showed up the front desk staff seemed untrained and unfriendly. After waiting for 15 minutes they told us our reservation had been "moved" to the queen and crescent hotel. How the bloody hell do they "move" your confirmed reservation to another hotel? It seems these hotels are owned by the same owner and the advertised rate we found is some kind of deal the marketing deal they use to fill all their hotels and they don't really seem to care where you booked just that all their hotels are fully occupied.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, not the best service.”
Reviews.Author: kisha5000
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel due to the Groupon deal that they had for $59 a night. It included half off of valet, and a Mandatory 8.95 + taxes, which was fine. But we had someone enter our room while we were in it... NOT HOT.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay unless desperate”
Reviews.Author: Kree1980
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a king size, nonsmoking room for one night. After check in, we open the door to our room to find it already occupied by a lady. She was startled as well as us. (hello don't you people check this first). We then haul our luggage back to the lobby for ANOTHER room only to put into a queen size smoking room with a filthy floor, stale smoking smell, hole punched in the wall and iron with no ironing board. By this point we were already running late to meet up with other people in our party so we just sucked it up for the night.. As I woke in the mooring to find the door swing lock thing not pushed up against the wall, meaning someone opened the door while we were sleeping - SCARY!!! Finally, we check out and waited for the valet to bring our oversized vehicle (don't offer onsite parking) to the hotel (we sat for a good 1/2 hr or so waiting before they called the valet people a 2nd time to bring it and that took another 1/2 hr).. We get into our vehicle to find that the valet company hired by this crap hotel hit one of those low clearance bars in parking garages and scrapped the entire top of my truck AND scratched up my sunroof which now I have to get it repaired.. Ugh!!! This trip has now cost us WAY more than it was worth

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Horton4
Reviews.Content: Please do not stay here. The rooms were small and unclean and the staff was inconsiderate. We waited over 2 hours for our car to leave on our departure. Price was cheap and you still did not get what you paid for. Ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the reviews.”
Reviews.Author: JoshnAne
Reviews.Content: For the price of the Royal St. Charles, I expected not much better than a Super 8. But our stay was so much better. We only stayed the weekend, but our room overlooked St. Charles Ave. The service was courteous and helpful. Room was clean. A small burn in the carpet, but not a big deal. A/C in a hot city was welcoming. And PJs Coffee shop downstairs helped make up for the fact that there was not fridge. Street Car stop just outside was VERY convienient. Seriously. Ignore the bad reviews. This place was awesome. Low price made it that much better.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: Gypsy70Houston_Texas
Reviews.Content: After reading a few negative reviews, I was apprehensive about staying here. This is a no frills hotel where you get what you pay for. We reserved the superior king room at $85 for Friday and $95 for Saturday. We received 50% off valet parking. The hotel informed us WELL ahead of time about the 8.95/night resort fee (that some people are complaining about). Even with the fee tacked on, it's still a good deal. There is even a sign posted at the front desk about the fee. Yes, the room WAS small, but this is common in the NOLA Downtown area. In the past, I have paid about $240 per night for a room at the Inn on Bourbon Street that was only about 2 feet larger. MANY hotel rooms in NOLA are small and charge $30 per night to valet park.....I paid only $15 per night parking. You're going to pay hefty prices to park your car ANYWHERE you stay in the dowtown/quarter area. I arrived on Friday at 4:30pm, my car was parked and I was checked into my room within 15 minutes (I reserved over the phone on Wednesday). It DOES take about 20-30 minutes to get your car OUT of valet parking, but with a little planning and calling ahead, you can have the car out by the time you have finished getting ready in your hotel room. I prepaid in advance and checkout was fast and efficient, considering I called ahead 30 minutes to get the car out. The room WAS clean, but as previously stated, the hallways and rooms could use NEW carpet. Hopefully, the hotel will start working on this. My restroom/shower were really clean. I was able to walk to the French Quarter 5 minutes. The St. Charles Streetcar right outside the hotel took me to the Garden District. Overall, the hotel is EXACTLY what I expected. It's not like staying at the Ritz Carlton, but neither is the price. Who wants to go to New Orleans and sit in a hotel room anyway? I wanted to sightsee and party. I needed a clean, decent place to shower and sleep. There is NO swimming pool, like some of the hotels in The Quarter, but again, I wasn't interested in hanging out in a hotel. There are too many sights to see. The front desk people were NOT overly nice, but not rude either. I was not pampered, but that's NOT what I was paying for. I would stay there again, no problem.

Reviews.Title: “5 minutes to reserve ...... an hour to cancel.”
Reviews.Author: cdlasch
Reviews.Content: While driving to New Orleans, we called thier toll free 800 number to make a one night reservation. It was actually some company named Travel scape or scope...never could get the foreigner to pronounce it right! Told repeatedly that the total price including valet parking and taxes ...TOTAL PRICE was $80 per night for senior rate. We booked a room. One half hour later we arrive at hotel and get run around from front desk lady. Very fast talker, and seemed like she was trying to take us. She found no reservation but it might be in the system later...like hours later! Said the $80 price was a no go anyway, and would not give us a price until we signed in with credit card. Also said we already owed hotel $15 for walking in the front door!. ......Asked for her manager...not available for an hour or so! I spent next 1/2 hour recalling the 800 number to cancel. Got repeated run around and dropped calls, but finally canceled and fled New Orleans. Never paid the $15.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-Great Price”
Reviews.Author: NancyJ422
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights last week. It was a last minute switch from a hotel in the Garden District and I'm SO glad we switched. We got there at 11am on Friday and they checked us in no problem, no waiting. They got us set up with the airport shuttle and when it was late, called to make sure they were coming. One block off Canal and one block down from Bourbon Street.

Reviews.Title: “nightmare”
Reviews.Author: pissedoffneworleans
Reviews.Content: The staff is nice, and thats where the good stops at. The rooms are dingy, smelly old looking and the beds looks like someones 4yr old kids attended to them. also, I booked thru HOTEL'S.COM and they were no assistance to me in finding me another hotel, they basically told me I was stuck with this room and hotel. I talked with a supervisor at Hotel.com by the name of Oscar Martinez who had an attitude because the room was not satisfying. Whatever you do, do not book with these people and take notice of the comments about these hotels before you check in.Also there is a hidden fee of $8.95 per night that HOTEL.COM does not mention. How convenient. My suggestion is read the comment section and take HEAVE or you to will be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: jodiep82
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on this website I thought I'd give the hotel a try. It was exactly what I expected right down to the need to replace the carpet and cold hallways. I would definitely stay there again because the value and location certainly made up for a few minor flaws. I was granted early check-in by 3 hours and late check out until 12:00.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for the Money”
Reviews.Author: Bengals9
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Royal St. Charles June 17-20, 2011. We booked our trip through Bookit.com. This is not the Ritz Carlton or Waldor Astoria, so you have to keep your expectations in perspective. Positives: rooms were clean, beds where comfortable, A/C was cold, water pressure great, front desk staff were very helpful and accomodating, business center was very helpful negative: WiFI connection suffered. our bookit.com vacation package guaranteed complimentary breakfast; upon arrival, the staff said they had not offered that in over a year since PJ Coffee moved into the 1st floor, plus our room, 212, did not have a safe. The frontdesk offered to refund the $8.95 resort fee for each day for our party of six since complimentary breakfat was one of the big reasons we chose this hotel. They told us bookit.com was updated before to remove this from their booking. We were given a small queen size room upon checkin. I asked for a move to a corner, King bed room and they were able to accomodate the request the next morning. When we needed to leave, the front desk arranged for a cab to be waiting on us. Overall, staff were fantastic. The carpeting throughout the hotel could probably be replaced as it is worn and dated. One of our rooms had torn sheets placed on the beds. Bathrooms are small, two cannot share at the same time. We did not have any noise problems at all, even with a batchelor party and batcherlotte party in the hotel all the weekend, no issues and they even invtied us along to party. The hotel could just work the 'resort fee' into the overall price and I would bet it would receive less negative feedback as that seems to be the rott of the comments on this site. BUt the rooms were very clean and if your there to shower and sleep, no problems. If your expectations are for the Ritz, then you may be let down. The booking also included your choice for free swamp tour or riverboat cruise. For the price you pay, RSC is a good value with the appropriate expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: RoxleyAustralia
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to Bourbon Street and other attractions, but without the noise. Always felt safe walking home in the early hours of the morning. Reception staff were very friendly and helpful. Would be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience.”
Reviews.Author: warkat325
Reviews.Content: Very enjoyable stay at this hotel. Great price and great location. Staff was very friendly and extremely helpful. Two blocks from Bourbon Street. Stayed in a corner suite which we were upgraded to at check in. Room was clean and quite. Coffee shop in the lobby was convenient for a light breakfast. Street car stops in front of hotel. All in all, a terrific value.

Reviews.Title: “Unprofessional Service”
Reviews.Author: kimsum
Reviews.Content: My daughter and friends stayed overnight last weekend. My credit card was used to make reservations. My daughter made a point to tell the clerk that they would be paying for the room in cash. You guessed it, the room was charged to my card. They were also told valet parking was included and you guessed it, my card was charged after the fact for over $60 for valet parking.They cold have gone around the corner and parked in a public facility for $30! I live nearby and we visit the city and stay in hotels often. We will not be using this hotel again. There are too many others true to their word.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been more pleased”
Reviews.Author: cheriecay
Reviews.Content: I was really worried, as we read some horrible reviews. Don't believe everything you read! On arrival, we were shown to a room with a queen sized bed, but we wanted a king. The first room was small, but attractive, and would have been very acceptable if we weren't so used to a king bed. When we asked for the larger bed, they changed us to a corner suite, which was very nice, quiet, and roomy, for a small upcharge. The hotel staff couldn't have been nicer from the desk to the maintenance man we saw on the elevator. The location was perfect...Close enough to easily walk to the fun, but away from the noise our friends encountered (staying on Bourbon St) all night long. Also, the trolley stops right there. Can't beat it for a price...

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break Trip”
Reviews.Author: Mumsie75633
Reviews.Content: Great location! Across Canal Street, about 1 block from French Quarter. Good part of town; a little away from the party atmosphere of The French Quarter, but close by when you want to "pass a good time." St. Charles Streetcar stops in front of this hotel. Coffeeshop downstairs for quick breakfast on the go. Very friendly staff; valet parking attendants were quick and attentive. Great place to stay for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfacory amenities, reasonable, and within walking to Bourbon and waterfront”
Reviews.Author: Raphael000
Reviews.Content: We checked in, got a street side corner room as requested, cordial staff, didn't need to use car during 3 day stay. Streetcar passes in front. Convenient location to Canal St., French Quarter and waterfront. Suggest calling desk in advance to make contact and express any special request and reason for selection. Arrive with smile and courteous requests and staff will respond likewise. Can't beat the rates, particularly during promotion periods, usually early in year and fall, notwithstanding Mardi-gras time.

Reviews.Title: “In need of a refresh”
Reviews.Author: dpnelson73
Reviews.Content: Location and price are attractive. Bedding is not up to par, walls are thin and carpets both in room and corridors are in need of a serious cleaning or need to be replaced. Staff was fine as was the coffee bar in the lobby. Wireless internet was appreciated. Also while we had a window, many rooms do not. It serves the purpose but I'd probably look elsewhere on my next visit to NO.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but great location”
Reviews.Author: tjmoney44
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for part of a recent New Orleans trip. Had a room with 2 beds shared with 3 other people, thought it was quite small but soon learned that alot of NO hotels are like this, especially boutique ones. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful with questions, location was great as it was technically in Central Business District but just a block away from Canal Street and French Quarter. Only negative was a kitchen fire occurred during our stay which forced us to evacuate our rooms for a half hour, wouldn't have been a big deal but one of us was in the shower at the time! Overall I would recommend this hotel for anyone looking for easy access to FQ and Bourbon Street, but wanting to be a little bit away from the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Unique hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: tageorge0930
Reviews.Content: First you need to know that this hotel was a bank building first, that is why there are no windows, but they have found a creative way to let light into the rooms. The customer service was outstanding. I called the front desk one time for a little help and they had a guy up there in just a few minutes (under 5). They do not have a continental breakfast, but they do have a coffee shop of sorts. Everything was within walking distance. We parked our car with the valet for the entire trip. We never had any trouble parking with our valet, while other hotels (bigger chains) were all full. The hotel gave us a map and helped us get around. We had two teenage girls with us so we had two rooms. I paid a fair to almost excellant price. The St. Charles street car stop was right on the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Hugh disappointment after great Jazz Fest”
Reviews.Author: Chuck78644
Reviews.Content: 10 minutes after entering our room, water was all over the floor due to a faulty toilet. It was 45 minutes before it was addressed and no alternative room was offered and actually denied when ask for. As we mostly attended Jazz Fest the rest of our stay was uneventful UNTIL. At checkout, they lost the keys to our car and when they found them, the Fob to unlike the doors was missing. (A 100.00 expense for us) Jazz Fest fans steer clear of this place. The manager did not even care enough to talk to us before we left, he told the desk clerk he was just too busy.

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong for location and price”
Reviews.Author: OkieFlash4
Reviews.Content: We always stay at this hotel when traveling to NOLA. You simply can't beat the price or location. The rooms are small, but the beds are comfortable. The last time we stayed at the hotel, we were lucky enough to get one of the rooms with a terrace and I was able to sit on the terrace and watch a movie being filmed. The staff is very nice and easy to work with.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate Hotel at a good price”
Reviews.Author: RQH123
