Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of its location and price. It served its purpose well and was a quick walk to the French Quarter which was great since we were traveling with our 7 year. Also quick access up Canal Street to Riverwalk and the Aquarium. Nothing fancy and the room probably could stand to have a good cleaning (the bathroom floor was kind of sticky). But the price was right and the room really was sufficient. I would recommend to anyone looking for a bargain price with close access to the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: CenlaTraveler
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Royal St Charles Hotel for a quick overnight trip to New Orleans. I had never stayed there before, but my son had been there during a college sponsored trip. I was familiar with the location of the hotel, and the rate I found was the lowest in this general area. The hotel is not fancy or luxurious by any means, but I found it to be clean, comfortable, and it certainly met my need as a safe place to stay for one night. The room was small, but the bedding was comfortable and it was absolutely fine for one night. The staff were very friendly and the valet and front desk associates were efficient. The location is a huge plus for this hotel. Its easy to get to almost anywhere in the "toruisty" parts of the city. You can easily walk to the Riverfront/Convention Center area, the French Quarter is just across Canal Street, and the St Charles street car stops in front of the hotel. A cab ride from Frenchmen Street is $10 with the tip. I travel to New Orleans several times during the year, and I've stayed in every level of hotel there is. I would definitely return to this hotel if I needed a less expensive room for a short stay. I had absolutely no problems at all.

Reviews.Title: “I'd never before been given a room that did not have a window!”
Reviews.Author: rikku00
Reviews.Content: However, the hour was too late to search for alternative arrangements--very claustrophobic. Be sure to check on this when making a reservation. The Hotel is fine in other respects, great location and great coffee bar in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Mardi Gras Celebration!!!”
Reviews.Author: melissacq
Reviews.Content: At first I was a little scared due to the bad reviews I read about the Hotel but honestly my boyfriend and I didnâ€™t experience anything negative while our stay there for Mardi Gras 2011. They only thing was that outside the hotel and pretty much everywhere else there was soo much trash (the next morning the streets where clean).However, once we enter the hotel it was very clean and the staff greeted us very friendly. They provided us with a parade schedule and gave us ideas of possible sightseeing locations. Our room was very clean along with the bathroom and the bed sheets. We didnâ€™t encounter any bedbugs (we checked). Housekeeping was GREAT everything we came back to our room the beds where done and the bathroom clean with new towels. Even the bathrooms at the lobby were very clean. The parades pass right in front of the hotel and I can pretty much watch them from my room window. The Hotel is in a GREAT LOCATION everything is in walking distance!! Bourbon St is only 2 blocks away and so is the French Quarter. Next year we plan to participate in the Mardi Gras Celebrations and we will definitely come back to stay here again!! =)

Reviews.Title: “Everything was splendid!”
Reviews.Author: LeAnaB
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel the night of March 8, Fat Tuesday. Tamara at the front desk was most helpful, determining our room was available earlier than the stated check in time of 4:00. So we were able to get settled in earlier than expected and enjoy Mardi Gras even more. This hotel is right off Canal, so it is very close to the French Quarter, Jackson Square, Harrah's, and all the places you want to see in New Orleans. Our room window looked down on the parade route, which was all cleaned up Wednesday morning. The valet parking worked excellently, very quick to bring the car, and very helpful folks running this service. Our room was clean; we rec'd extra towels very quickly. One of the mattresses was a bit squishy for me, but I just traded with my other campanions who liked it better than the firmer one. Our price for this room through Expedia for Mardi Gras was very reasonable (booked a couple of weeks ahead of time). I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Served it's purpose but won't be back”
Reviews.Author: abennett79
Reviews.Content: Positive things first. The beds, comforters, and pillows are very comfy. The clerks and valet people were friendly. You have to consider how extremely busy they are during this time of year but they all smiled and were at least cordial. We had free wifi access that was very fast. The complimentary soap smells awesome and the room was pretty clean. The hotel is located right in front of where the parades run through so you can step right out of the hotel and onto the sidewalk and be right there watching the parade. Sadly that is about all I can say that is good. Now for the bad. We had a double room and 4 adults and we were absolutely tripping over each other. There are 2 double beds, a nightstand, and a tv armoire crammed into a tiny room. This room isn't even the size of a normal one bed hotel room. The bathroom is equally small, our toilet broke 4 times, the water never really gets hot and there is no water pressure at all. Now to be fair the maintenence people were very friendly and finally fixed the toilet issue. I'm also willing to bet that the hot water/water pressure issue was due to the hotel being packed, but if things were done right we should have all had plenty of hot water. The other problem we had was that it took over an hour to get our car when we checked out but that was also during a parade. Our main reason for not staying here again is the size of the room. You do not get what you pay for in this case. They are basically packing people into tiny rooms and making more than the Motel 6 does for larger rooms. Another reason we will not stay is not the fault of the hotel but it's location. You are right there for the parades but if a parade is going on you cannot get across the street. You can go a block the other direction and get to Bourbon St but we enjoyed the French Market area and Decatur St much more and it was impossible to get there during parades. So I guess this hotel would be great for a group of teenagers or very young adults but it's not for anyone else. Also whoever said something about the noise, I don't know what they were hearing because we never heard a thing. It's not a horrible hotel and I'm not pissed about our stay, but it didn't make any of us happy enough to go back. Our next Mardi Gras will be spent in a hotel on Decatur somewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Never in a Million Years”
Reviews.Author: hrhbob123456
Reviews.Content: The Royal St. Charles Hotel ruined our 6 month planned Mardi Gras. You would be better off staying at a Super 8. Living in Maine, we had made our plans for a month long vacation that included Mardi Gras. We made our reservations at the St. Charles, six months in advance and got a reservation ID. We stayed in Covington the night before and did a check of the hotel on Friday, asking the front desk when and how to check in on Saturday the 5th, as we knew the parades and such would be a problem. Was told that the check in time was 3pm between scheduled parades. O.K. We planned our return for that time. We were ready to deal with the crowds, the crawling traffic and even the torrential downpours but we were not ready for the Royal St. Charles. Itâ€™s obvious they had over booked. They cancelled our reservation that morning before we presented. They ran our credit card and it was declined. A couple of months before, our card was a subject of fraud. The credit card company handled it very well, but I never thought about this reservation being on this card. When I pressed, saying why did you run the card before the check in time, I got blank stares and a statement that they called with a notice to our home in Maine on 3/6. That was the TOMORROW! Excuse me?? I pressed a bit more, was given a valet number and my car was taken to be parked. They â€œfoundâ€� a smoking room, not what we reserved, and we said o.k. Going to the bank of three elevators, we found that only one was working. More bad news. Our room was on floor 5 (of 9). As we got off the elevator looking for our room number, a lady said that was her room! Back down to the desk, with the lady. Seems that they had done a similar thing to her that day. They had been scheduled to arrive on Friday and called ahead, saying that they wouldnâ€™t get there until Saturday. Was told they still had to pay for that night. They then gave their room to someone else and when they put the key card into the lock, they found people in their room. Back to the desk. They then gave her and her family the same room we had. Double, double booked. We had to wait a couple of hours for our car to be brought around and we left town, never seeing a parade, walking Bourbon Street and getting that good Mardi Gras feeling. The only good things we experienced, were the poor lady who was jerked around and the valets who took our car and brought it back again. Donâ€™t know if Mardi Gras is in our future, but certainly not at the Royal St. Charles.

Reviews.Title: “Location was great, quality was not what we paid for”
Reviews.Author: AriBull
Reviews.Content: This is our second boutique hotel experience. We are still working on what to and not to expect when staying in one of these. The rooms were much smaller than what we saw online. The walls were very thin - we could over hear our very drunk and very sexually active neighbors every night including their argument new years day. There was no microwave or functioning refridgerator in the room. There was a locked mini-bar fridge but it was no longer in use but still left in the room for no reason. The staff at front desk was not friendly or helpfull at all. The room was a non-smooking room but still smelled of smoke. The linen on the bed was of poor quality and did not breathe well. We expected better. The elevator and carpets were very old and not well maintained. The coffee shop in the hotel lobby had good coffee but the pastries were quite average. We loved the location and were able to walk to all parts of downtown. The trolley stopped outside of the hotel but that was of no help since it rarely came by. I would only recommend this hotel for a quick weekend stop over but not for an extended stay or if you have kids. When we checked in our bill included an expensive parking charge but it was taken off the final bill since we didn't park a car with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem near the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Atepower32
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a pleasant surprise. It's located only a block from the French Quarter and within walking distance for a majority of the local attractions. St. Charles Streetcaar stop is just outside the door. It also features PJ's Coffee shop in the main lobby The hotel staff was friendly and the room was very comfortable in clean. Would definitely stay there again and well worth the value at less than $100/ night.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ThreeofakindinPA
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel in the heart of New Orleans!! Very friendly staff and service was top notch. Loved the vouchers for the coffee shop in the lobby. Streetcar stop right outside the door and can walk to everything - Harrah's, Bourbon St and French Market. Would say there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE OF FRAUDULENT CHARGES”
Reviews.Author: juju1268
Reviews.Content: I booked my reservation online for the Royal St. Charles Hotel and was charged TWICE for the room, when I only made one reservation! The hotel refused to refund my money and said that it was MY fault for booking the room twice, which I did not do. I have stayed in numerous hotels, booked online, and have NEVER had this problem in the past. This hotel also charged us the full amount for both reservations in advance and would not cancel the reservation. Also, neither of the amounts charged on our credit card matched the actual amount on our confirmation! There is definitely something fishy going on here. Hopefully my credit card company will be able to get to the bottom of this because the hotel staff has been extremely unhelpful!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: smccaughey
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in New Orleans where he was performing at a music festival in the French Quarter. We were definitely on a budget and the Royal St. Charles met our needs very well. The location was perfect, we were only two blocks from the Quarter. We booked a queen room for $79 a night. The lobby had a great coffee shop. Our only complaint was that our room on the 10th floor was very hot and stuffy. Tried putting the thermostat on cool, and then turning the entire system off -- but neither worked very well. There was no window to open. But other than that, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Second time here - will make it a third!”
Reviews.Author: mrsg
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two nights in NO (my original home) and I am a bargain hunter. Through BookIt.com, I got the RSC for $65/night and that included free parking (I saved $58) and two paddlewheeler cruise tickets. We didn't take the cruise, as the temperatures were in the 20's and 30's. However, we did take the same cruise this summer while staying at sister property The Ambassador, and thoroughly enjoyed it. I do recommend it. We had stayed at the RSC four years ago, and I much preferred this latest one. For one, they have taken out the bar in the lobby and replaced it with a PJ's coffee shop. We were even given several $2 vouchers for purchases there. The location is great! One block off of Canal St and you're in the Quarter. A short 3 block walk took us to Harrah's. There is a Subway across the street and a little restaurant serving lunch and dinner next door, however we did not get a chance to try it. Our room was very clean, nice amenities, everything worked fine. My husband and I had ample room. No complaints! The main reason I booked this hotel was because of the free parking and I already knew the accomodations would be fine. I'll definately keep this one on my list for my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: kiwigurly89
Reviews.Content: I was really nervous about staying here. There are a lot if bad reviews for this hotel but i was relieved when i arrived. Our room was really nice. King size bed. Clean bathroom. AC/Heat worked great!! My ONLY complaint is that there wasnt much hot water. I suppose that its because everyone shares it. If you wake up super early or sleep in till about 11am, you'll get hot water but if you wake up around the same time as other guests it's luke warm at best. Other than that my stay was great! Great location. Within walking distance of everything. Oh it does get a little noisy outside early morning but its not that bad. I think i would choose to stay here again next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but not much else.”
Reviews.Author: jhm539
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a wonderful location but leaves much to be desired. The rooms are tiny! We upgraded to a junior suite and still had trouble walking around with two people in the room. The suite consisted of an odd sitting area with a love seat & two chairs, one of which blocked the only closet, from there a very narrow hallway led to the bathroom & sleeping area. The bathroom was so small it was hard to close the door while you were inside. The bed was old & uncomfortable. If the whole room had been open it would have been much nicer. Friends of ours stayed in a King room which was small as well, but with an open layout made much more sense. The room was extremely dated and was in need of a makeover; peeling wallpaper, water damaged art, broken wall fixtures, etc. On a brighter note the staff was extremely nice & helpful and the location couldnâ€™t be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: rebel0121
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Royal St.Charles in December for a Saints game. I booked the room through Expedia which advertised free valet parking with my booking. I aniticipated free parking until we got there. We were told that there valet parking was full and we would have to park our car down the street. When questioned about our free valet parking booking, they told us we would be responsible for the $15/day the place down the street charged (it was actually $25/day so they lied about that). The front desk manager said the free valet booking is subject to availablity. There was nothing on expedia's website that stated this. The front desk manager told me to take it up with expedia. I was not pleased with this at all and this was just the start to our miserable stay. There were stains on the carpet in the hallways and in the room, the fitted sheet would not stay on the bed and the some of the staff were not friendly. There was no service elevator so maid carts, maintenance, etc. rode elevator with guests which I found annoying. The second day, we had maid service come and clean our room but they left no towels. At 4:00 pm, I told a maid down the hall that we needed towels and she said OK. At 5:30 pm we still didn't have any towels. I went down to the front desk to ask for some and they sent somone up within 10 minutes with towels. The room, hotel lobby was drab and needed updating. We will not stay here again. I couldn't wait to get out of there!

Reviews.Title: “Good Bargain!”
Reviews.Author: SWNM
Reviews.Content: You can't beat this deal: a comfortable king bed, free valet parking, and tickets for a paddle wheeler tour for less than $90/night including fees and taxes... and it's only a block from Bourbon Street. The room was a suite with a separate sitting area and a city view. The bathtub stopper wouldn't close and there were a couple of burned-out lightbulbs, but the room was clean and had wifi. Unlike some reviewers, we had hot water. A coffee bar is located in the lobby, and many restaurants are within walking distance. Why pay more when you don't spend much time in the room?

Reviews.Title: “If you're thinking of staying here for Mardi Gras, think again! Big bucks No Service.”
Reviews.Author: pegler1
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I went to New Orleans for Mardi Gras last year. We booked a room through BookIt.com for the Royal St. Charles for five nights over Mardi Gras. We booked two months in advance, requested a king room, and were assured a shuttle would bring us to our hotel. When we got there, we found out the closest a shuttle can get you is 8 blocks away. En route, we called to verify our room, and were told there was no room for us. They told us instead to go to The Queens and Crescent where they had arranged a room for us. At 2am, we are hauling our luggage around New Orleans during Mardi Gras and went there, only to be told no such arrangement had been made and there was no room for us there, either. We ended up getting a room in a third hotel, out of the way. The next day, we were told to come back to the Royal St. Charles and they would move our luggage for us. We did so. We ended up with a handicapped room with two full beds instead of a king suite. They failed to move our luggage, and I ended up going back to the out of the way hotel, and pushing a luggage cart through the streets of New Orleans at midnight so we could have our bags. We paid $200 for this. BookIt.com did nothing to help the situation, even though we called them about ten times throughout this ordeal.

Reviews.Title: “no hot water!”
Reviews.Author: sallytravelsalot
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights. Check in was slow. Valet parking was fine, quick retreval of our car at check out. Rooms were small and run down. There were no stoppers in either the sink or tub. We came back to the room at 2:30 and neither room had been cleaned by the maid. I would not have written this review except for the fact that we had no hot water the whole time we stayed there. We were told that it was because it had to come from the 10th floor and we should let it run longer. No matter how long we ran it lukewarm was as good as we got.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst experience ever”
Reviews.Author: PeerlessChino
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the royal st. Charles. It was the most horrific experience I ever had. Upon entering the hotel the clerk was extremely unfriendly and had a very unpleasant attitude, I believe her name was Erica. Stay far away from her if staying there. The lobby smelled like mildew and the room was even worse. In addition to the mildew, the non-smoking room smelled of smoke. The sheets on the be were not clean and visible stains were present. If you want to enjoy your vacation I recommend spending a few more bucks and stay at a 4-5 star hotel. I was not paid to write this review nor do I work for the Other hotels in the area. I'm just trying to help all you people out there not make he same mistake I did. Peace, love, and light people.

Reviews.Title: “The worse hotel we have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: KISSYDEE
Reviews.Content: This was awful!! It was our anniversary and we chose the romance package!!! The photos on the site are very misleading!! We both took COLD showers, toliet was broke, lights werent working,out-lets werent woking which lead to NO COFFE, NO CLOCK,Room was so small!!! AND WORSE OF ALL THE GIRLS AT the front desk are rude and apparently dont like their jobs!!! Also I selected a romance package and of course when we got to the room it was NOT THERE!!! For the price we paid and experience we had we will never recommend this hotel or stay EVER AGAIN!!! You need new staff and someone to always check the rooms before you put someone in it..

Reviews.Title: “We were very pleased with everything !!”
Reviews.Author: drushea
Reviews.Content: I read many reviews before booking... Honestly I was skeptical... We liked the location and felt it was worth a try... we were pleasantly surprised...everyone was pleasant and informed.. our room was spotless, from what we could see the entire hotel was extremely well kept, our room was not large, but more than sufficient for our needs, we even had a balcony (2nd floor). The walk to the French quarter was one block, Burbon St. was 2 blocks. My wife and I would definately stay here again ! And we would highly recommend this hotel to our family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel and neworleansonline are deceitful, deceptive and mis-leading”
Reviews.Author: sMiLe112010
Reviews.Content: This hotel and neworleansonline offered free valet parking with our stay. However, come to find out, that is not the case. The hotel states that, that is on a first come first serve basis and conveniently enough we were not the "first come". To have to pay an unexpected $29 a day for parking will quickly put a damper on your vacation. Oh and their parking is at some empty, unwatched lot a couple miles down the road. Of course neworleansonline.com would do nothing to back up their false advertisement as they were not forth coming to let you know that you are actually being booked through hotel.com. So in turn be very leery when using neworleansonline.com and make sure you check out and verify ALL of the rules of the hotel you are planning on staying at. It states nowhere that parking is at their discretion. Check it out for yourself at www.neworleansonline.com, look for Royal St. Charles. Very Very disappointing!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is anything but "Royal."”
Reviews.Author: wajohn432
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. The lobby consists of the check-in desk and a sofa and 2 chairs. The only other thing in the lobby is a P.J.s Coffee. The rooms are extremely small and there are only about 4 television channels and no movies to rent. Unless you are coming to town to party all day until you pass out, I would not recommend this hotel to my worst enemy.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: gonzales713
Reviews.Content: 1st time to New Orleans, Louisiana, Bourbon St and this was not a good hotel...actually by far the WORST hotel i have ever stayed at. i picked this hotel because it was a block from bourbon st and it was CHEAP. you get charged an $8 fee for wifi and the fitness room. The pictures are deceiving and they DO NOT HAVE ON SITE PARKING!!! you drop your car off with the hotel's valet service that cost $30 A DAY! you have to CALL 1 HOUR before your ready to leave so they can have your car back to the hotel by the time your ready. Some people waited longer than that. When i get MY car back there is a nice DENT and some SCRATCHES where the driver had backed into something. We spoke with the valet supervisor and we were told that it looked like someone had brushed their LEG against my rear bumper thats how the SCRATCHES and DENTS got there...all i could do was laugh. we spent 4 hours of our morning/afternoon dealing with that issue, and as we wait in the lobby a guy tells us that the valet ppl were using his car to transport other ppl!!!!! Valet service also left a customers keys in another customers vehicle that had already left the hotel...THIS PLACE IS A JOKE!!! DO NOT STAY HERE!!! PAY THE $210 A NIGHT AND STAY WHERE YOUR CAR IS GOING TO BE SAFE AND ON SITE.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for the price”
Reviews.Author: SpeedsterM
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at the Royal St. Charles and found it to be above expectations. Based on previous reviews we were pleased with the cleanliness, comfortable beds and pleasant service staff. We used a special package which included free valet parking and stayed for well under $100 on the edge of the French Quarter. Room was small but efficient and the fixtures were of good quality, so we felt very good about our choice and would gladly stay again. Would recommend that you bring a multiplug/power strip for electricity.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Be Deceived”
Reviews.Author: Eagles_Wing1
Reviews.Content: Royal St. Charles 135 St. Charles Avenue New Orleans, LA 70130 Check-In: July 1, 2010 Check-Out: July 2, 2010 I booked this hotel as a Pre-Essence Music Festival stay before moving to my timeshare for the rest of my stay. I booked it because the property was running a special that included free breakfast and free parking. I was familiar with the location because I have stood in front of it many times waiting for the trolley on other visits to New Orleans. I had also patronized the lobby bar but I had never actually been in the hotel but from what I saw, it seemed like a decent property. The property is ideally located- one block from Canal Street and the French Quarter. The staff was very friendly. Based on the room that my party was assigned, this property is a dump and there is nothing luxurious about it, as stated on the website. Deceptively, the lobby area looks pretty nice as does the hallways. I could not believe the condition of the room when we entered, however. Where there was carpet, it was filthy. In some areas, the carpet was worn down to the flooring. There is not a room on their site that looked like this room. The walls and armories were marred with colored crayons. There was not any sort of desk in the room as shown in the pictures on their site. There was nothing contemporary about the furnishing. I would categorize it as â€œEarly Garage Sale.â€� The beds were supposed to be Queen-sized but they were not, they were Full-sized. The sheets were so dingy and wrinkled that they must have been packed up since Katrina. The sheets were so thin and worn you literally could see through them. The coverlet was supposed to be a duvet. The inner comforterâ€™s filling had separated into many balls making it very lumpy. The pillows were the same way. The filling had separated into lumpy balls. The site advertised modern bath amenities. We had nothing but a few dingy, worn towels. We arrived rather late that evening so we decided just to sleep in our clothes & socks and check out as soon as possible the next morning. Donâ€™t be deceived with their specials and free amenities either. The free parking and free breakfast was recovered by a per person â€œresort feeâ€� and with exorbitant Service Fees. While waiting for our car, I checked out the â€œFree Breakfast.â€� The breakfast area is located behind the double doors behind the reception desk. This area must double for a janitors/housekeeping closet because there was trash piled up in the corner as well as housekeeping carts, brooms and mop buckets. There was no seating available but stacked against the wall were tables and chairs. The actual breakfast consisted of sweetened & unsweetened breads, regular coffee, powered cappuccino & hot water. There was nothing to dip the cappuccino out of the container with and nothing to stir condiments into your coffee. There were not even any disposable plates or saucers. But what was worse, was that the table cloth was black and absolutely filthy. The dirt and stains were not from that mornings serving either. They had been there through many presentations. This property has mostly been rated as a three-star property so I was not expecting six-star accommodations but I would not even give it any stars. Any property, no matter what the rating, should, at the least, be clean. I read some very positive reviews about this property. I can only write about my personal experience. Some properties have been guilty of holding their worst rooms for Blacks and other minorities. Maybe this is what happened with my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Be advised!”
Reviews.Author: taylorj222
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal St Charles for the weekend. The service was adequate, the room was very small, but it was clean and the bed was fairly comfortable. The biggest problem was the fact we had no hot water. We had to let the water run literally for 30 min for it to get less cold. We informed the front desk who did send someone up. They're response was "just let it run for a while. It will warm up, but it's not gonna be real hot". Yeah 30 mins later it was cool water instead of cold water. We toughed it out but any hotel should provide the bare minimum of a hotel. A place to sleep and bathe. We wont be back. One other annoyance was they charged us an $8 "resort fee" to use the fitness center and "free" wireless internet. WTF?! Plus parking is $30 a day so this place is no bargain.

Reviews.Title: “My husband and I stay at the Royal St...”
Reviews.Author: GeauxSouthernBelle
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stay at the Royal St. Charles from time to time but I would really like to write a review because I had a sub par experience this time. The hotel is located in an amazing part of town which makes it an ideal place to stay. It is close to everything and right on the street car line. The only downfalls (and granted.. probably not deal-breakers) are that the staff is not overly friendly, and the rooms need updating. Our comforter was frayed and the lampshade had a hole burned through. Also, the hotel imposes several fees. So be aware!! Overall an average stay.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT RELY ON THEM”
Reviews.Author: Robert S
Reviews.Content: I had made my reservation and obtained a package that included Free Valet Parking. I knew that there was a New Orleans Saints game in town the night I was arriving and that parking would be difficult. When I arrived there was no one outside the hotel. When I called in they told me that Valet had been shut down and that there was no other options. NO OFFER TO ASSIST AT ALL!!! After much fighting they agreed to cancel my reservation with no charge. This left me at 6PM scrambling to find another hotel............

Reviews.Title: “Great family atmosphere-near everything,but far enough from the bustle!”
Reviews.Author: sjbrinker
Reviews.Content: My sister and I took a much needed vacation. This hotel gave us great service and visiter advice! Erica,and Tamara at the front desk were friendly and helpful! The valets, Patrick and Chris were full of advice and treated us with friendliness and were professional - in that they retrived our auto and had it cooled for us- all we had to do was hop in and off we went to tour! The housekeeping department was eficent and responded quickly to any requested items. We will stay again at this clean and friendly hotel! Thank you .

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: bralossus
Reviews.Content: Our stay at The Royal St. Charles was not the worst experience I ever had. The room was small, but clean and location of the hotel is great. The only complaints I had were the walls are definitely too thin! You hear everything going on in the hallway and in the room next to yours. They need to work on a new valet system. They don't have a parking garage, so they use numerous parking lots scattered around the city. The valet told me some of there lots are as far as 10-12 blocks away, so getting your car can be a bit of a hassle. Overall, it wasn't a bad hotel experience, but I don't think I would stay there again. For the price, there are better options out there.

Reviews.Title: “BEDBUGS!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cinos524
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Royal St Charles during a Music Festival weekend. The second night of my stay I realized there was about 6 small bumps on my wrist that itched. On the day of check out I woke up early to call down for my car when I turned on the light I see bedbugs crawling in my bed. As I checked out the front desk agent said there was nothing he could do and to call back and talk to the manager. It took an additional two days and speaking with two more employees before I spoke with the manager and at no time did anyone apologize and the only reason the manager apologized was because I bought it up. The room was small and when I arrived to my room on the first day there was no iron or iron board and when I went to call down for the items I realized there was no phone. The staff was okay until the bedbugs incedent...I guess the hotel stay was a lessioned learned.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: leanderjim
Reviews.Content: GREAT location, friendly staff...........perfect for dirvers.........the valet parking was perfect........the price was great................Erica at the front desk was wonderful..........all the staff were friendly and attentative.........

Reviews.Title: “If you're driving, it's not worth it”
Reviews.Author: Jalexa22
Reviews.Content: The rooms were fine, yes small, but ours was in good shape. The hotel was in a good location. The "breakfast" was kind of strange, they gave you a $4 gift card for the coffee shop in the lobby instead of actually having a breakfast available. The real kickers were that the staff wasn't very friendly- not during check-in or check-out. And the worst part, the deal breaker for us, was the waiting for the valet in the morning. When we checked in they told us to call downstairs 45 minutes before we needed our vehicle. We called down like we were told to, and still ended up waiting for 2 1/2 hours for our car! We had a reservation somewhere that we had to cancel because of this. The entire lobby was packed full of people all in the same situation. There was no waiting space for anyone, so the lobby floors were full of people waiting for hours for their cars. They wouldn't let us go get our own cars. None of the staff looked organized and their system for retrieving cars was a disaster. Once we finally got our vehicle and were driving off, we even saw a few of the valet guys hanging out on the sidewalk talking to people down the street when they were supposed to be getting cars for the tons of people that had been waiting for way too long. This specific thing was so poorly handled and aggravating that is wasn't worth it to stay at this hotel for any price. I would never stay there again, not even if we got a free nights stay.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location and value, a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: morton1974
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great place. An easy walk to the French Quarter, Financial Distirct, Shopping, and Museums. Hotel is within easy walking distance of the train station, which is a great way to travel to New Orleans. If you don't want to walk, a street car stop is right outside the front door. The room was great with a cool view of the street, one entire wall was a window overlooking St. Charles.

Reviews.Title: “Not happy”
Reviews.Author: ndb6322
Reviews.Content: The only thing I can say , is that the room quality and the overall hotel quality was not what I expected . The first room we were put into was a corner room and it was great except for the fact of being bit by bugs . I dont think they were bed bugs but non the less bit. They moved us to another room on another floor . The room was smaller and was very noisy . I asked if we could be moved to a quiter room and the front desk personel was rude and acted as if I did something wrong . She gave me a new room ,but proceded to tell me to bring the keys to the other room back . I was not happy with the other room because it had loud plumbing issues . Not Happy with New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Friendly Staff - Trolley Stop outside the door!!”
Reviews.Author: razorbackshelley
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel from June 18th â€“ June 20th 2010 and had a wonderful experience. In summary, this hotel was a great deal and VERY close to EVERYTHING! The St Charles Street trolley stop is literally right outside the door of the hotel. Since the hotel is a block away from Canal/Bourbon, you can isolate yourself from most of the rowdy crowd noise yet walk with confidence / safety to all of the festivities. We stayed at this hotel last year and opted for a standard room. Although the standard room was small, it had new furniture and was very clean. This time around we stayed in a suite room (room 209) â€¦â€¦.. WoW! This room was bigger than my first apartment. We had a full-size living room w/ a leather sectional couch, small kitchenette (microwave, small refrigerator, sink), two-vanity bathroom with a full-size shower and separate tub, and a great balcony. The hotel staff was fantastic. Specifically, the Valet team! Just a quick note for any of the hotels around Bourbon/Canal â€“ daily parking for any hotel in the area is around $30.00 per day. So if you donâ€™t need to travel a long distance during your stay in New Orleans, it may be better to hire a taxi/shuttle to/from the airport instead of a rental car. The valet staff usually has to park your car several blocks away from the hotel. So, it is wise to pre-plan and call ahead by 30 minutes prior to needing your car. In our case, the valet ticket clearly said 45 minute wait time, but our car was at the front door within 10 minutes. I would recommend this hotel to couples, friends, and families* (*donâ€™t venture past canal street after dark).

Reviews.Title: “Hidden parking fees were a bait and switch...otherwise...”
Reviews.Author: envy1067
Reviews.Content: Being a little overwhelmed with where to set my husband up for business trip in a place as big and diverse as New Orleans.. I contacted hotels.com, by phone. Was happy with arrangements until.......Was forced into a hidden mandatory $29 door valet parking. After arriving. To late to cancel was screwed. You are told by front desk that is the only choice when you get there, however there is public paid parking around the corner. Would have been nice of them to admit that. The valet was very nice and made sure my husband vehicle was there immediately when he left at 5:30 AM. The beds were very comfortable and the room was nice, but very small...New york type small. The only way this hotel is a "good deal" is if you get the 1/2 price $63 dollar rate, after the hidden $29, and the hidden&7.95 fee for the free breakfast, that he by the way never got, and the other ammenities then it comes to be equal to any of the other $114.oo rooms at other places. So shop with that in mind ...do you want a hotel that tells you Before you get there that it is gonna be a $46.95 ( and that is not counting taxes, our 63 dollar room turned into 72 upon booking and grew to $126.99) worth of hidden frees, or a hotel that has upfront pricing. Mind you this stay was booked first thru a company repping the St. Charles and then I called and confirmed...Not until I called and asked best road (third call) did they tell me about the mandatory valet parking...Never would they have volunteered it.

Reviews.Title: “Basically Like Staying in a Motel 6”
Reviews.Author: AmyDF7735
Reviews.Content: Me and a friend were in on business and booked this hotel because it was in walking distance of where we needed to be. The rooms were very small, but we expected that. Someone had apparently drawn on the walls in our room with a black permanent marker and the hotel attempted to cover it up with a different color paint. The furniture is very outdated and the beds were horrible, the springs would "pop" when you moved. As others stated, the walls were paper thin. While attempting to "sleep in" I was constantly awoken by a screaming baby and a mother telling her other kids they needed to behave. Our phone didn't work, the remote to the tv didn't work and the room felt kinda dirty. Thankfully we just stayed for one night.

Reviews.Title: “clean room, great value”
Reviews.Author: MsPyar
Reviews.Content: Don't let some previous bad reviews keep you from staying at this hotel. Location is just a few blocks from the french quarter and the rooms are clean and the beds are comfortable. I am very picky when it comes to cleanliness and I was comfortable in this room. Due to some of the other reviews my expectations were low but I was pleasantly suprised. Bed linens and towels were stain free and fresh smelling and the carpet and tile and shower curtain in the bathroom were clean. The furniture was not new, but you can tell that the staff takes the effort to keep everything maintained. We stayed for $49 a night and felt it was a very good bargain. We would not hesitate to stay here again. Parking is $29 a night but that is the normal for most any hotel in the city. Try Serio's next door for a mufaletta.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice stay. Will stay again”
Reviews.Author: rowgray
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned home from our stay at the Royal St. Charles Hotel. We were celebrating our 18th wedding anniversary. We were really scared about staying there because of all of the horrible reviews we read before going. The hotel was great. We did not go expecting it to be a 5 star hotel so that helped alot. The hotel has great location! We were 5 mins away from everything (Bourbon Street, The River Walk, and Harrah's). The staff was very nice and helpful. Lots of other reviewers complained about the valet parking. It took a total of 15 mins for us to get our car each time we called for it. Granted we did not stay during Mardi Gras or the Superbowl, but the city was packed with tourist. I would recommend any one to stay at the Royal St. Charles Hotel if they are coming to New Orleans to enjoy the city and be close to the main attractions. The room and the bathroom were slightly small but clean. We had hot water, clean towels, a clean room, and great customer service all for a fantastic price. WHAT MORE COULD YOU ASK FOR! Thanks Royal St. Charles for a memorable 18th Anniversary weekend. See you next year. Signed, Pleasantly Pleased

Reviews.Title: “Location is the Only Good Thing”
Reviews.Author: ElectricBaby81
Reviews.Content: There were only two things that were good about this hotel: (1) the location on the corner of St. Charles and Canal Street and (2) the staff were very nice. So the cons you ask? Oh, where to start... The hotel web site and Expedia both stated that valet parking was available. However, they failed to mention that it cost $30-$40 and in order to get your car, you had to call 45 minutes in advance. This ruled out the opportunity to make last minute plans to go somewhere out of walking distance and almost made us late for our dinner reservations at Emeril's Restaurant. Also, upon checking in, we were told there was a mandatory hotel fee which covered wireless internet, long distance calling, and a bunch of other things that we absolutely did not need, want, or use. Once the fee and parking were added to the bill, the hotel was way too expensive for what we got. As for the room, the walls were apparently made of paper. We could hear every bit of what the people next door were talking about, and they were not being loud. Also, we were on the third floor, and the street noise was terrible. New Orleans is a 24-hour city, and between the people screaming/cheering, the street car, police sirens, and traffic we couldn't sleep at all. (I would definitely suggest that no matter what hotel you choose in New Orleans, ask for a room high above street level.) To make the sleeping issue worse, the bed was incredibly uncomfortable, and it seemed as though we could feel every spring. Additionally, the bathroom was so tiny, you couldn't even get in the shower with the door open. The toilet was practically under the counter, and two people could definitely stand in the space, much less share the sink or mirror. We've had more room in baths on cruise ships! Also, there was no complimentary bar of soap, shampoo, or anything. There was a coffee maker, but only decaffinated coffee was provided. Who going to a 24-hour city like New Orleans wants decaf??? Finally, we were told by the hotel web site and Expedia that there would be a complimentary breakfast. This amounted to coffee and biscuits/croissants, absolutely nothing else. I'm not a coffee drinker, and there wasn't even orange juice or water to quench my morning thirst! In closing, I am actually from the New Orleans area, and believe me, there are much better places to stay for the same price. Ones that include parking, a great location, and better rooms and amenities. We stayed at this hotel because a friend told us it was a great value. They couldn't have been more wrong!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: Ibbecky
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at this hotel after our cruise. It was horrible. The staff was rude and not very welcomeing. The room was supposed to be a non smoking room but reeked of cigarette smoke. The room was dirty and very small. The sheets on the bed were on inside out. The business center consisted of a rusty old desk and one really old computer. If it was not jazz weekend we would have found another room. I would never stay there again and would not let my worst enemy stay either!

Reviews.Title: “Close To Bourbon”
Reviews.Author: aphein
Reviews.Content: OK so this hotel is very close to Bourbon which is a plus. I have stayed in this hotel before about 3 years ago and had issues with vallet parking and this stay in March 2010 the vallet parking is still the worst. It's slow there is nothing more I can say. The staff wasn't the nicest but hey I didn't go there to make friends with the staff it was just a place to lay my head for sleeping. It was clean but the rooms are very small but again I just had to sleep there so I just needed place for a bed. It's not fancy like some hotels in New Orleans but it's considered a boutique hotel and it'll do and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I was very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: akwannabe
Reviews.Content: I booked rooms for my boyfriend and me and my daughter and her boyfriend. Then when I started reading the reviews I was very nervous about staying there. I'm not sure what all happened to the dissatified people but our stay was great. All of the employee's treated us very well and were all very helpful. Our rooms were also clean and comfortable. We also never had a problem getting our car. I really feel all of the bad reviews are from people who want 5 star treatment. If that is what they want then thats where they should stay and pay for it.

Reviews.Title: “Will NEVER Stay there again!!!”
Reviews.Author: 1adeana1
Reviews.Content: I took my husband to New Orleans for his 45th birthday, also to visit the French Quarter Festival. We were given room 204 which was VERY noisy- (trolley running until midnight), bed was VERY uncomfortable - NOT a King bed as I reserved!! The toilet stopped up (should have been a hint when we checked in a Roto Rooter was in the lobby!!). We called to report it and was told we had to go to the front desk to get the plunger and unstop the toilet ourselves, bad service!! Bar has been shut down since Feb 1. It cost $25 for late check out after 12, flight did not leave till 4:30p, no pool, no restaurant. No bottled water, vending machine was broken and only had 1 machine for the entire hotel. No complimentary toothpaste. Overall stay was horrible, to say the least!!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again, just self park your car!”
Reviews.Author: dazed69
Reviews.Content: Arrived thursday april 1st around noon, very easy check-in and valet took my vehicle right away. I wanted a balcony room and for a nominal $10 per night extra charge I got one. The room was rather small, but large enough. The bed was very comfortable and the balcony was nice to have. The bathroom is quite small as well, but, when your in New Orleans you really aren't planning on spending alot of time in the room anyways. Checked out Sun, the 4th, went down to front desk to get my car on the list for valet at 11:30 am. Came down stairs at 12:30 with my luggage and proceeded to wait, it was Easter so I expected a little longer wait than usual. After over 2 hours of waiting I finally asked the clerk if I could go with the guy and retreive my own vehicle. I was told that my vehicle was "lost", meaning that they had moved it from its original parking lot to another but didnt change the paperwork. After walking to the other lot, there was my car. Teh valet told me they had a few vehicles that this had happened to. As a whole i will stay there again, pretty good location, not far walk at all to al lof the French Quarter attraction. But, I will not be using the valet parking, even though it was free in my package deal, I will pay extra and park my own car instead of waiting over 2 hours to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Dont do It”
Reviews.Author: lgrobert
Reviews.Content: I stay in New Orleans on a regular basis and was put in this hotel at the last minute by another hotel who overbooked their rooms (The Omni that is a whole other issue). On arrival the valet person ignored us. We then were greeted by rude front desk people who were not busy at all. We were put into a room that had stains on the floor, carpet and walls. It did not appear the sheets had been cleaned. We immediately left the room and my wife agreed that it was only one night and that we could bear it. We did not return to the room until 2:30am as we were out with some friend doing normal New Orleans things. I would not say it is a very safe walk to the room from the French Quarter as we were harrassed on several ocassions on the way to the hotel. If my wife had not had enough wine we would not have been able to stay here. The last item I will metion is that valet takes your car to an unlocked parking lot in the central bussiness district. The only reason I know this is because I was told I would have to wait 45 minutes to an hour to retrieve my car in which i requested them to just bring me to the parking lot. Once teh nine other men ahead of me figured out what I was doing we all treked through the back alleys of New Orleans I would estimate about five blocks to retrive my car. The valet kid told me how at night he gets really scared doing this. So just imagine the safety of your car. I tilpped teh kid 6 or 7 bucks and thanked him for helping me. He was the only decent employee I encountered. I will tell everyone I know not to ever stay here. Oh yeah the hotel room stunk and when you turn the lights on in the bathroom a constant buzzing noise was made by the lights. My evening was not a romantic one I would say the least. There is of course more I could say but I will end here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place. Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: MandD_Travels
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at the end of February. Feclicia at the front desk was great and she did a great job at making sure everything was as perfect as possible for us. As for the other young ladies who work the front desk........ that is another story. They were busy fixing their hair & makeup and taking pictures of themselves with their cell phones to be bothered with questions or requests. One of the girls had her thug looking boyfriend pop in for a visit. I would stay here again even though their pillows suck!! I complained several times to the front desk that they were flat and hard but never was able to get a good one

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Disappointed...”
Reviews.Author: Meghuneyntyson
Reviews.Content: First off, let me say that the people who worked the desk were awesome. Loved them. I read through allll the Tripadvisor reviews before traveling so I would be completely aware of what was to come.I figured that most people must be big complainers after seeing some of the good reviews from a few other folks. I was wrong. The front desk and lobby were nice. We arrived to the hotel and while my SO sat outside waiting for someone to valet my SUV, I went ahead and got in line to check-in. I was able to check-in after ten minutes and no one was there yet to valet my SUV. We waited outside for about thirty minutes. Finally someone came. I was aware that it took quite some time for your vehicle to be brought out front (expect to wait 45 minutes) but it was more annoying having to wait for someone to take your vehicle at all. Everytime we arrived back from somewhere, same problem. The people complaining about the dirty carpets were correct. We had a burned spot on the carpet in our room and the room was tiny as was the bathroom, but it was decent. The bathroom, however, had no stopper. We had to use a washcloth to plug in the stopper to take a bath. Also, on our last night, we could hear clearly the conversations of the people in the room next to us. They'd returned back from Bourbon, obviously, at 2 a.m. and continued a discussion for at least another hour. We could probably tell you each word of the conversation as it felt as if they were in bed with us talking - the walls were that thin. I will not be returning. I'd rather spend the extra money on a better hotel. We got parking free - thank GOODNESS, through the third party site we booked through. Next time, I'd rather spend the $30 - $40 a night for better valet. The first night we slept there we were drunk after a night of partying and just passed out. The next night, sober, we could barely sleep. The mattress was horrible. The location is great, however, the money wasn't bad at all, and the staff were helpful. We needed more face towels one morning (after using some to plug the drain in the tub) and they were promptly delivered. The women at the front desk that I dealt with were great, as well.

Reviews.Title: “Only stayed one night out of reserved 4. That sums it up.”
Reviews.Author: KCandAJ
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel experience of my life. Please review my other contributions and you'll see I'm usually very pleased with accomodations and don't feel I'm a very demanding person. I was rudely greeted at check in but thought nothing of it, the elevator had a horrible smell and I ignored. However, when I checked into my "deluxe room" with a non smoking request I discovered that not only was it a smoking room but also had a musty odor and NO window. I've seen several large city hotels that have rooms without windows but ALL other than this one NOTE that the room has no window at the time of reservation. This hotel did not. The woman at the front desk advised me, "some rooms have windows and some do not but that doesn't change the price". There was also a large glass block wall between my room and the room next to me. I could not see thru it but everytime the lights in the room were on the light would shine into my room (even when the people in the room came back from Bourbon St at 1am). I called downstairs and was told that there were no other rooms available and I could not switch rooms. I tried for a while to deal with this but could not so I requested to switch rooms the next day for the last 3 nights of my stay and was told I could not switch rooms in the middle of a reservation. I cancelled the future nights on the reservation and spent the rest of the evening calling area hotels for an open reservation. The next morning I was advised I would have to pay $170 for the night instead of the $99 I booked since I was staying only one night and not the 4 booked nights but I didn't care as long as I was able to get out of the hotel. I was lucky to find a Hilton Garden Inn a few blocks away that was available and went there the next day and had a wonderful business/leisure trip after that. The people at the Hilton Garden Inn felt so bad when I told them about my experiences that they upgraded me for free. One last thing, watch for the odd $7.95 mandatory resort fee that will be in fine print. What does your "resort fee" include, how about the amazing safe in your room, use of a fitness center and free long distance and local calls. Please notice the sarcasism as who cares about calls when everyone now has a cell phone and every other hotel in the city provides a safe and fitness center included in your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: edtani
Reviews.Content: The lobby of the hotel looks old, not maintained at all, and dirty. My travel agent make the reservation for six nights. The room was very small, the carpet was dirty and burnt. and unexpectedly, the room was without window. I was nor ready to pay 150$/day for this room. I claimed to change the room/ The manager of the hotel said that they are fully booked. I found a nice hotel in the vicinity. but unexpectedly the manager decided that I need to pay one night for my refuse to stay in this horrible room, one night cancellation must be applied??. I do not think that expectation of a nice, normal size, clean room, a window in the room are exaggerated. According to other reviewers is it possible that other rooms are better. but my conclusion and recommendation is simple . Avoid this hotel!! There are so many nice hotels in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay!”
Reviews.Author: jennux
Reviews.Content: I must admit I was very nervous about this hotel after reading all of the horrible reviews but turns out it was a very pleasant stay! Our room was spacious and comfortable with huge windows and a super soft bed. My only complaint would be the valet service which seemed very apathetic. I understand it was Super Bowl weekend combined with Mardi Gras so it was ridiculously busy. However, we had free parking through the site we booked the hotel with and though there was no space available we were flippantly told there was nothing they could do (comps, money off bill, etc). Some sort of effort would have been appreciated. I loved the location - very convenient to the Quarter and casino and I would stay here again in a heartbeat. I'd just leave my car home next time...

Reviews.Title: “Terrible staff and management”
Reviews.Author: chickradio
Reviews.Content: I stayed here Superbowl weekend, and quickly discovered that the management and staff's horrendous attitudes and poor decisions were not only lazy, but potentially harmful to the crowds of people gathered for parades in the neighborhood. At minimum, this staff needs to be completely retrained on how to handle high volume, if they plan on remaining in that neighborhood. At worst, the management should be replaced, before they make a decision that could hurt someone. STAY AWAY.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: ChasandJanM
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room 412. Plenty of room. Comfortable king sized bed, sitting area and ample bathroom. Clean, simple and inexpensive. Staff was pleasant and very helpful. Plenty of hot water and towels. Location is great. Trolley stop right outside the door. Only one block to the French Quarter so it is easy to stumble home after a night on Bourbon street! Mandatory facility fee of $7.95 gave you a light continental breakfast which was coffee and danish.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal, perfect for business or pleasure & close to French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: jimmydime
Reviews.Content: Went on Priceline and got this room for a very nice deal, far lower than others in the neighborhood. FREE VALET PARKING. That's worth $15-$20 a night right there. The rooms were clean, modern and neat. Had a nice view of St. Charles & the Trolley. Grabbed a nice cup of tea and a few danish at the Free Continental Breakfast in the morning and I was on my way to my business meeting. Made use of the Business Center with printer, which was great. ONLY negative was the sound the toliet made when I or the room next door flushed. Other than that it was a Great Deal.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Bad Place At All”
Reviews.Author: Ishernyro
Reviews.Content: I really can't understand all the complaints; people can be so fastidious. The staff was friendly and cordial enough. The rooms are not like the Beverly Hills Hotel, but they're clean, and have all the creature comforts one could want. I was pleasantly surprised at how quiet it was at night, although on Friday at 2:30 AM, I heard these inebriated debauchees yukking it up. That wasn't the hotel's fault, though; it had to do with revellers in town for the Saints/Vikings game. And what does that reviewer mean, talking about burns in the carpet? He/she must have requested a smoking room, like I did. You have to expect that the room is not going to be in pristine condition if it's a smoking one. It was as clean as it could be. The hotel is kind of an ample walk to the heart of the Quarter, but that was no major obstacle. Although I wouldn't necessarily stay here again (I like to try new places), I wouldn't dissuade anyone from booking a room here. It's a perfectly fine hotel. If you want sheer luxury, stay at the Ritz, which is a block or two away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!!”
Reviews.Author: lilcntrygrl
Reviews.Content: I don't know what everyone is complaining about!! I took my 20 year old son and my 18 year old daughter to New Orleans the weekend after Christmas, this was their Christmas wish, for the Saints and Tampa Bay game. We stayed at the Royal b/c of its convenient location to Bourbon, the French Quarter and a few blocks walk to the Superdome. We got FREE valet parking, which is outstanding to have in New Orleans b/c we walked everywhere we wanted to go. The rooms were nice and clean and for the short amount of time we spent in them, it was perfect. The beds were soft and comfortable, in fact my daughter said it was the softest bed she had ever slept in. I was so satisfied with my stay that I am booking another room right now for Superbowl weekend. The staff was extremely nice and helpful, considering they were dealing with all of the fans for the Saints game and the Sugar Bowl. They warned us about the 45 minute wait for valet and everyone was pleasant. I recommend this hotel to anyone who is planning a trip to N.O. GEAUX SAINTS!!! SUPERBOWL 44 here we come!! WHODAT!!

Reviews.Title: “Depends on your expectations”
Reviews.Author: Overbar
Reviews.Content: After reading the mostly negative reviews for this hotel, I was anxious to see if it was as bad as it has been described by some. My wife and I were in town for one night, 1/16/10, for the Saints playoff game against the Cardinals (WHO DAT!). If you're looking for a place to stay for a romantic getaway, or a quiet, relaxing weekend, this is not the place. But if you want a "no-frills" hotel in a great location (right next to the French Quarter, a couple of blocks from Harrah's) at a good price, and you're not going to spend much time in the room, this is not a terrible choice. This is a hotel to consider if you're partying with friends and want to be near the action. Positives: Reasonable rate for a Saturday night, free valet parking, great location, and we were able to check-in early. Negatives: Valet parking was a complete mess. I understand that they were trying to accommodate those checking out and those of us checking in early at the same time, but there were cars lined up and down the street waiting to be parked, and there were only two valet attendants. It took about 45 minutes to have my car valeted, and you couldn't just leave your car because there was a sign in the hotel lobby warning that the police would tow unattended cars. So you had to stand there and wait on the valet to take your keys. On a positive note, we had no problem getting our car when checking out. The walls are thin; while trying to sleep I could hear several conversations going on in different rooms at the same time. The carpet, linen, bathtub, pillows, etc., show their age. It's difficult to tell whether they are dirty or just old.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service, please stay away”
Reviews.Author: LegoJoe
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the worst service out of anywhere I have stayed. It took valet an hour to park our car. The best part was that we had to stay with our car. They would not take the keys until they were ready to park it. Dung, the valet man was very very rude to us. I can't believe the hotel has such a rude employee. He literally yelled at me when I asked him how long this was going to take. His response in yelling form was there are only 2 of us and it would be over an hour. Wow?! To valet a car?! In fact, I am sitting here now waiting to get my car to leave and have been waiting over a half hour. The rooms are pretty dingy. The coffee table was so beat up and written on. The windows are 10 feet high so you can't see out of them. The toilet had hair all over it. The bed was very comfy though. The shower had great shower pressure. The location is fantastic. There is also a bar in the hotel we had a nice time at. The bartender was very nice. Valet is $29 and there is no other parking available. There is also an $8 resort fee. So, a $119 rate ended up being $175. Beware! Stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Royal pain in the butt”
Reviews.Author: Fairfield25
Reviews.Content: Came to New Orleans for 3 days over New Yearâ€™s and would never stay at the Royal St. Charles again. Nothing but headaches!!! Upon arrival we were told there were no more king rooms available due to several being â€œout of service.â€� We ended up being moved to a tiny queen room with no window. In fact, if you check the hotelâ€™s website, you wonâ€™t find any rooms without a window. Donâ€™t rely on anything you see onlineâ€¦ very misleading. Our front door did not latch, which we didnâ€™t notice until we went to leave for the evening. We then learned the front desk was already aware of this problem and didnâ€™t bother to mention it. Only one of three elevators were working properly. There was no hot water for showers in the morning. Not even warmâ€¦ the water was ice cold!!! We called for more towels and received only half the number we requested and they were not even folded when brought to us. The most devastating part of it all is that the valet wrecked our new truck on both sides. We didnâ€™t notice right away due to the fact that we had to wait 40 minutes longer than told to get our car and then were rushed away by the valet. After extensive complaints and emails to the hotel GM (Michelle Ruether) all we got was a partial one night comp. Clearly not enough to compensate. This hotel is a JOKE and a waste of money. We are very dissatisfied and would not recommend this hotel to anyone. If you think youâ€™re still interested after reading all the bad reviews, keep in mind that the use of Wi-fi, the in-room safe, the fitness center and the worst continental breakfast are all extra charges. They also tack on a daily resort fee, parking fees, per night occupancy charges, and 13% tax to the advertised daily rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - No Complaints”
Reviews.Author: LoGuy80
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this particular hotel back in September '06, (a year after Katrina) and I found it to be a very good experience. The front desk receptionist were more than friendly and helpful, and the room was quite comfortable and very clean. Nothing comes to mind as far as anything being a bad experience. It was a great location, right across from Bourbon and not far from the Harrah's Casino. I've read a lot of the recent comments... and I'm quite surprise. People have to understand that sometimes its not the hotel fault if the rooms are in poor shape, its sometimes the guest(s) fault for trashing it, and also thinking they are staying in the "Royal Castle" and not just a nice clean hotel. Anyway, even my stay was almost four years ago, it still was a good stay and I would recommend it to friends and I would stay again if ever in Orleans again.

Reviews.Title: “new orleans stay”
Reviews.Author: fikishadaniels
Reviews.Content: checking in was great Felisha was a great host and was very friendly she would be one of the reason I would return. But there was one guy there that did not want to assit us he was a black guy that stated in front of us that he was not going to help us at all. I thought that was so rude. I was very upset of his comments. On sunday the day to check out there was no hot water and we had a long trip ahead this was another disappointment. Over all every one else was nice except that one guy i wish i knew his name but i promise you that Felisha who was the best person whom we came in contact with could tell you who he was.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: soylesley
Reviews.Content: Don't waste your money. If you enjoy stained carpet, horrible mattresses, dirty looking linens and cigarette burns then you'll love this property! OH, and don't forget the hot water that last about 4 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “We feel ripped off.”
Reviews.Author: valcjj
Reviews.Content: We booked our 3 night stay through our reservation with Amtrak and were told what we were paying included everything. When we arrived we were surprised to find out that there was a $7.95 mandatory resort fee per night. We tried to explain what we were told by Amtrak but the desk clerk was rude and demanded payment. If they want to charge more for their rooms they should do just that.

Reviews.Title: “BEDBUGS!!!”
Reviews.Author: cristinagf
Reviews.Content: Great location, comfy bed, not bad for the price...until....I noticed that I was becoming incredibly itchy. After joking for days that I had bedbugs, while leaving, I noticed a bedbug crawling across my pillow engorged with my blood. Now I'm at home with about 40 bites and itching like crazy. Staff was pretty apathetic, so I didn't even bring it up at checkout. I don't think they would have cared anyway.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Experience EVER a Must go and stay”
Reviews.Author: Addie40
Reviews.Content: First let me say that I was at first very worried about this hotel bc of the reviews that had been read on here. But when the people talk about Erick at the front desk being so helpful that gave me hope. And guess who was at the hotel upon check-in that's right it was Ericka and she is the BEST! She gave us excellent service upon check-in and provided us with tourist information since it was our first time there. The room was very nice. I like that it had a foyer type hallway into the room and then you turned into the actual room itself. I liked this that way no one could if the door was opened just see into the room and what was going on or whatever. We had a 6th floor corner room with a nice view of the city streets. The jazz club downstairs was nice not too noisy but you could here it at night if the tv wasnt on. I suggest taking a small fan to block out noise that is what we did. The house keeping staff was excellent. The location was very good and the trolley stop is right outside of the hotel and for those who don't know it but St. Charles Ave. is or appeared to be the main street down to the Garden District which is a must see. And I suggest everyone do the "Haunted History Tours" and even buy the book... I never encountered not a single problem even with the Valet parking I was worried about that since parking is not on site it is a few blocks away but we turned our vehicle over to valet parking the night we got there which was a Thursday and did not get it back until Monday at check-out so needless to say we did alot of walking or riding the trolley but it was all worth it in the long run. A much needed getaway for the Hubby and myself!!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best low cost hotel next to Burbon”
Reviews.Author: ser182
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here on Business for the past 3 years and i can say it is a very nice under priced secret near Burbon.

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: SMSCozumel
Reviews.Content: The rooms where nice, very small, not spotless, but clean. Really comfortable beds!!! The front desk staff was rude, made no attempt to be friendly at all. The parking was annoying. They have no room to park while you wait for valet, you can get backed up in the street, or have to circle around the block. The valet attendents are also rude, and several one dollar bills I had in the middle compartment of my vehicle disappeared. The hotel is in a GREAT location, you can walk to everything. Besides the staff (which we did not interact with much) this was a good hotel for the price and location! Be aware, they charge $26 a day for valet parking and also $7.95 a day for internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Good if you have 'University student level expectations' in a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: memjon
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel with friends for two nights. The beds we comfortable and clean. However the over all condition of some of the finishes in the rooms need work/cleaning. You can definitely tell Mardi Gras/Quarter and it's guest have taken it's toll on the hotel over the period of time. The bathroom was clean, but there was a large stain on the carpet outside of the room. There was also some pink mold along the edges of the bathtub and around the nonslip shower mat in the tub. The desk was rude when we arrived. They also failed to bring an iron up to the room after 3 request. The house keeping, while properly cleaning the room left very few towels. Having said that, it was a cheap place to crash in the quarter so I didn't expect too much. We paint $174 for two nights stay.

Reviews.Title: “It is centrally located, with excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: mond24
Reviews.Content: I received great service from Dashan the front desk clerk. My reservation wasn't showing up in the system and she went above and beyond her call of duty to assist me and get my reservation taken of. I would rate her service, 5 star. On the other hand, the valet was horrible. They directed me to my vehicle instead of bringing it to me. This wasn't the entire staff, just the ones I encountered.

Reviews.Title: “Erica N. was FABULOUS!!!!”
Reviews.Author: makingrunway
Reviews.Content: She was the nicest desk clerk I have ever done business with. She was able to tell me where everything was, and if she wasn't sure of where it was, she had no problem looking it up for me. She was also able to give wonderful advice on places to eat and even hot shopping spots. She is a very sweet woman and so easy to get along with! Thank you Erica for making my first visit to New Orleans a wonderful experience! :)

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for-- service is inconsistant”
Reviews.Author: dadiehl
Reviews.Content: 1st off, the location is GREAT; and the hotel knows it.. which is perhaps why they are sliding.... mess in the d/stairs bathroom upon arrival; wall paper tearing off in the rooms; rooms end up being TINY since they use an antiquated wardrobe/tv stand. Bathrooms attempted remodel is comendable. Day clerk was extermely nice and helpful and would have saved this negative review but night clerk had a problem with us; She wouldn't let a checkin occur; even though our bags were stowed arleady and we presented credentials; the party w/ the credit card had to be there and he was down the street at harrah's.. they could have been more accomodating at 2am. Parking difficult as always but parking attendents very accomodating. Worst thing was; I called the hotel management to get my "free day" (we stayed two days and they were having a promotion to get a third). I got this weakly constructed excuse that my rate was real low since I called ahead and he would have to charge me more for a free day.. i know bull$hit when i hear it

Reviews.Title: “A most awesome place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: TripleD6
Reviews.Content: We read the mixed reveiws on this hotel and decided to go with the majority and we are so glad we did. The hotel was very clean, the rooms were clean and the staff was very accommodating. They were very friendly and gave the best directions and personal suggestions. We will deffinately stay there again. It was convenient to Bourbon Street and the market and the best restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Helpful Staff, Clean Rooms”
Reviews.Author: NYLOSUP
Reviews.Content: A friend of mine recently came down from Utah and had never been to New Orleans so we decided to take a road trip (Im from Dallas). After strolling Bourbon and the surrounding area for a while we decided to go ahead and check-in at ther hotel. When we arrived, the FD agent (Erica) could not find our reservation (I had made it through a third party site). The computer system on property seemed to be running slow so the agent asked if I would mind contacting the company that I made the reservation through and have them fax over the confirmation to them. When I called the comapny they said it was going to take up to 30mins to get the confirmation faxed over which didnt make me very happy, but what can you do, so I hung up to wait. In the mean time Erica was very conversational and super friendly. After about 10 minutes of waiting, she went ahead and got us all checked in and said that she would take care of everything when the confirmation got faxed, but because it was late she didnt want us to have to just stand around the lobby and wait. When we got up to the room we had a corner unit on the 6th floor that looked out over Common and St. Charles. It was pretty basic in terms of furnishings and decor, but it was plenty for two people just looking for a place to sleep. The cleanliness of the room was more than satisfactory although a little more attention couldve been given to the shower (little bit of mold in the grout). As a hotel professional myself, I would only recommend that the management pay a little more attention to the small things like peeling wallpaper (small places in the rooms and hallways), lightbulbs that are burned out, handprints on the large windows, and again the bathroom. As I have already mentioned, Erica was/is an absolute pleasure and truly an asset to the property.
