The AM Agent (a man), although friendly enough was a little hurried sounding when I tried to call to get my car from the valet as well as when I went to the lobby to checkout. He did not inquire as to how the stay went or even say thanks. I will reiterate though that the stay was an overall positive experience, and the location is fantastic! Laissez les bon temps rouler!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: southrn_charm
Reviews.Content: Its a great location for the value! Staff is always freindly and helpfull and you can't beat it for the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay with the 2 for 1 summer special!!”
Reviews.Author: SPEEDSCALIEN
Reviews.Content: We live about 4 hours from NO, and when I found the 2 for 1 special last saterday morning, well, we just hopped in the car and went! The location to the FQ is fantastic and it has the St charles streetcar stop right at the front door, taking you to theGarden district. The special included FREE valet parking (a rare find in NO) and service was with a smile, although we only used our car1 time to explore outer areas. The room was like a small hampton in room, with comfortable bedding and pillows. The bathroom was very nice as well. Our room (806) on the 8th floor was quiet, except for the nightlong wailing of a baby, fortunately they left the next day. Not the hotels fault. I could not get the safe to work, but hey, who complaine a bout $129 for 2 nights . Everything else we walked to, even hubby who has dropfoot, could manage the few blocks to the aquarium (recommended) and cafe du monde (skip the coffee, get 3 beignets for $1.82 anytime). Combine this with breakfast at Fleur -de- lis cafe, 3 from the hotel ,and the $25 early dinner special at Bacco's (fantastic Lobster and shrimp ravioli, just watch the wine charges!) and you have the most fantastic budget trip ever!

Reviews.Title: “DON'T STAY HERE!!!”
Reviews.Author: mcap247
Reviews.Content: I've been a business traveler to New Orleans since Hurricane Katrina. I've predominately stayed at the Royal and their sister hotel, Queen and Crescent. Until recently everything was OK till they overcharged my credit card and would do NOTHNG about it, instead I got attitude from the manager herself. (I've spent 20,000+ over the years) Every time I came there would be a new person behind the front desk who didn't know what they were doing, but I overlooked it. Now I'm filing a dispute with the credit card company, which is a pain. Plus the "convenience" fee they tack on is ridiculous. Please don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Would like to comment on the front desk receptionist, Erica.”
Reviews.Author: NewOrleansVacation
Reviews.Content: Placed our reservation through Hotels.com and when we arrived the hotel was over booked. Erica went above and beyond to get us a room at another near by hotel. She was very professional and was the only person at the front desk juggling a number of things. She was very effiecient and pleasant and changed a negative situation into a possitive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel! Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: skujins
Reviews.Content: GOOD: -great location, right at St. Charles and Canal -quite clean -one of the most comfortable beds we have ever slept in -very air conditioned, which is necessary in the heat of New Orleans -friendly staff BAD: -valet was sort of slow (the parking lot seems very far away form the actual hotel), and you don't really have any other option but to use valet because there is very limited parking downtown. And unless you book some sort of deal where valet parking is free, it's $26 a night. -carpet in the room had many stains on it -we were given a balcony room, so there was quite a bit of noise from the street. If you're a light sleeper, request a non balcony room. -our room was also on the second floor over the bar in the lobby, so we could hear music from the bar. Again, we brought ear plugs so we were fine, but request a higher room if need be. One thing to note is that there is no continental breakfast. But you'll want to walk to Cafe du Monde for beignets anyway. Honestly though, when the only bad thing about the room is the dirty carpet, I'm happy. The music from the bar was a little annoying but nothing to make a fuss over. Overall a great and comfortable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: blackmemphisboy
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed staying at the Royal St. charles Hotel. The location was close to the french quarters, aquarium, bourbon, and the street car was right on the corner by the hotel. I came with my girlfriend and my son when I checked in I asked Erica for information on the aquarium and zoo. She was a big help. She printed out prices and addressed to the attractions and also gave me ice even through it was on my floor. She really went out her way to help us with finding things to do. I would come back next visit.

Reviews.Title: “very nice srevice”
Reviews.Author: aheg
Reviews.Content: customer service were very nice and very helpful they were very helpful in checking me earlier and valley parking my car and bring it in a timely manner location is very nice with conveninence to major attractions

Reviews.Title: “Royal St. Charles”
Reviews.Author: ma7seri
Reviews.Content: the hotel was kind of noisey at night they had this bar/club that palys very loud music at night. i think the girl on the front dest was called Erica she was so helpful and showed me where to go for food and helped me inside the hotel with towels, blankets etc...service was really good and everyone was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good location mediocre service”
Reviews.Author: rswill
Reviews.Content: Location is ideal for a near french quarter hotel. Rooms were booked with included valet parking however the hotel did not honor the parking vouchers provided and parking was an additional 30 dollars. In addition there is a 8 dollar resort fee charged per night. The staff were sweet but overworked and that meant that they were sometime short tempered and not always friendly or efficient. Towells were rags tattered on the edges and not very thick nor absorbent. The room was clean and the service was adequate. It was an OK place for our visit. Just not with out frustrations. Expect to have some when you book here. They appear to happen with every room booked. For the price of the room don't expect top tier service,

Reviews.Title: “nice motel but dont expect to get the "free parking" you are pomised”
Reviews.Author: nolavisi2r
Reviews.Content: First let me say that i would stay in this motel again. the rooms are nice. The ladies at the front desk arent very nice but thats not what i had a problem with. Its the very very terrible valet service. The motel has about 3 parking spaces out front, one had a truck that was working on the door. the other 2 were filled so we were told to ride around and around the block til the parking space was available. We rode about 6 times then decided to go park down the street in another garage. And if you see "$30 valet parking include" Dont fall for that. They do not honor it unless you have it in writing from who you booked through.. Also there is a $7.95 fee that will be added to each room.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome customer service!”
Reviews.Author: susan_3727
Reviews.Content: I went with 3 other people to new orleans for my 21st birthday. I've already been before but this trip was awesome! Josh and the other female lady who worked up front of the hotel were amazing!! He had such a great personality and helped get us towels, showed us good places to eat. And the lady she was a life saver, haha, i had a sash that said birthday girl, well it kept falling off and she gave me her own pin so i could fasten it to my shirt! the hotel was a good bargain. good price for one block over from bourbon!!! very nice at first glance but did notice a few imperfections. I would reccomend this hotel still!! and i plan on staying for my next trip

Reviews.Title: “We would stay here again when we visit New Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: LaMom1962
Reviews.Content: The room was very nice and clean. Yes, it was a bit small but that is only because we have always been used to having an extra table in rooms we stay in. We loved that the Streetcar passed right in front of the hotel. we found a really nice food court in the building next to us that I imagine is frequented by company employees. We had a very reasonably priced lunch there. Since I had already read some reviews, I knew that no Continental breakfast is served during the weekdays--they need to correct that on the website. Other than that, everyone was friendly and helpful. We got a great , "Stay one night, get 2nd night FREE deal" PLUS free valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: lovessunandsand
Reviews.Content: The Royal St. Charles is a great place to stay. I don't understand some of the past negative reviews. The staff at the St. Charles were very friendly and polite. They went out of their way to make our stay great. The room was a little small but very nice. The Royal St. Charles is just off of Canal street near all the fun places in the French Quarter. We are planning on returning to New Orleans and staying at the Royal St. Charles again. I would recommned it to all my friend and family. I would also recommned you bring a light sweater to New Orleans. Alot of shops and clubs are cold.

Reviews.Title: “Best bang for the buck!!”
Reviews.Author: Dannyslady1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is almost like a secret, it offers comfortable beds, pillows, balconies and the price is super. It's so close to everything and around the corner is a grill and they have the best breakfast on the planet, you can also catch a trolley right there in front of the Hotel to go down to the district or what ever makes you happy, this hotel rocks.

Reviews.Title: “A good experience”
Reviews.Author: GIReuter
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for the price. Rooms are not very large but comfortable quiet and clean. Staff is very friendly. They have coffee and pastry on weekends. Close to Bourbon Street, Shopping and Major Attractions. We will return :-)

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: snakeman663
Reviews.Content: Our room was kinda small but for the price it was nice. The staff was very friendly and helpfull. I have booked another trip there already and can not wait to see that friendly young lady that checked us in. My only complaint was we was on St. Charles Ave. and heard the trolly's all night. They even sent us down the block to Brothers to get some of the best fried chicken I ever had. Again thanks to the staff for making it a nice stay looking forward to seeing you next week.

Reviews.Title: “not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: beachy85
Reviews.Content: this place does not at all look like the website. PARKING --- MY $55,000.00 car was left on the side of the road in front of the hotel for 6 hours after the Valet had my keys--ALSO when we checked out 3 days later i come to find out that my car had been damaged while in their care I was informed that they were not responsible for any damages even though there is a $7.95 per day mandatory resort fee that includes 20k insurance so i took my loss and left. the photos of the rooms were not accurate as far as size of the room or the linens. we had a room on the 5th floor with a window that looked at the building next to us (NO VIEW) and it was TINY the T.V. was very fuzzy and and our desk light would not work the bath tubs seemed nice enough after we washed it (there was curly hairs all over the inside of the tub and the floor of the bathroom. the shower curtain was not wide enough to cover the entire tub so there was a chilling breeze coming in while showering. For a delux double room it sucked. One of our beds sagged so badly in the middle they put a matress pad on to try and help iguess but it did not even fit the bed half way through the night i had to get up and fix the bed because half of it was on the floor. the peep hole was shattered. if it had not been Mardigrass WE WOULD HAVE LEFT THE FIRST NIGHT but since we went to have a good time we stayed and played

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: rose1507
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights in the Royal St. Charles hotel and it was very nice. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a comfortable, quiet and clean hotel in New Orleans. It cost under $100 a night for each night and well worth it. The rooms were small, but we didn't spend much time in it any how. Very friendly and helpful desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it !”
Reviews.Author: tetowheat
Reviews.Content: Royal St Charles was great. Employees were very friendly & helpful. Room was a bit small but very clean & trendy. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends. They were doing construction when I last visited so they should have a bar on the 1st floor now. Stayed here for 3 nights @ $59/night then moved to the Intercontinental for 3 more nights @ $69/night. Both hotels were great but the International seem to nickel & dime you for everything.

Reviews.Title: “Women on the loose.”
Reviews.Author: tiger2462
Reviews.Content: After reading so many neg. reviews I was unsure of our stay. What a surprise for us. It was not the most disgusting place on earth but it did have a few minor issues. The front desk people were very nice and helpful. The bellhop was actually funny. The rooms are really small but overall okay. Who plans on being in the room during Mardi Gras anyways. $7.95 surcharge is bad when you don't use facility's and no there is not cont. breakfest during the week. Like we don't eat thru the week? Sat. morning there was lots of different pastry's. We could not get enough towels!! Our biggest problem. 4 women after one day of complaining should have done it but it takes a few times to get them to understand We Take a Shower EVERY DAY! We started hording our hair towels for the next day. For the price and location, It is average place if you can get it cheep. There is so much to do in NOLA that you only need a clean bed and hot water. I LOVE NOLA!! Planning on next trip already and Yes, if the price is right will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “THE WORST HOTEL EVER!! DON'T BOTHER!!”
Reviews.Author: nolalover78
Reviews.Content: If you like to stay in a hotel that has rooms without phones, towels, clocks, clothes hangers, or windows, etc. or that have not been cleaned prior to check in or that are still being occupied by current guests, go right ahead and stay at this horrible place. My wife and I booked 40 rooms with the Royal St. Charles for our wedding weekend in New Orleans and we are very disappointed with this hotel. From the reservation agent who likes to hang up on guests trying to make reservations to the general manager who can't seem to return any of the numerous messages I left, no one at this hotel has any idea of what customer service is. With the exception of the valets and bellhops, the professionalism of the staff was woeful. Quite embarassing when you have guests coming in from all over the country to experience New Orleans which is known for its great hospitality. My suggestion to the hotel management would be to file for bankruptcy.

Reviews.Title: “Awful hotel”
Reviews.Author: ehbnyc
Reviews.Content: I was put into a dark interior room with NO WINDOWS and one lamp that was full of recent cigarette smoke. When I tried to move, the woman at the front desk told me the hotel was full. I went out to dinner and when I came back a different woman was at the front desk so I asked her... they had plenty of empty rooms with windows. The other woman just didn't want to be bothered. The whole place is kind of a dump. Stains on the carpets everywhere, mildew in the bathtub, cheap mattresses, smoke everywhere. There are much much better places to stay in NOLA.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here...poorly maintained, dirty, poor service!”
Reviews.Author: Travelor2232
Reviews.Content: We checked into this hotel on the recommendation of a friend. We had never thought to check tripadvisor.com first since he recommended it. However, we were stunned at the countless problems we experienced at this hotel. Iâ€™ll start with basic service â€“ the staff was far from friendly or helpful, they were outright rude! The room was terrible and filthy! First, there was no window, therefore it was so incredibly dark and gloomy, but more importantly it was just dirty and poorly maintained. We asked to be moved, but found the second room to be just as bad, still no window and still dirty. Both rooms had at least ten stains on the carpet, dirty sheets (one set had lipstick on the sheets, the other a hair), the molding was falling off the wall, and the one piece of furniture was missing knobs. There is no continental breakfast, plus they charge a mandatory $7.95 fee per night for services, such as safe insurance, phone, internet, and fitness center, that we didnâ€™t intend to use. We ended up moving to another hotel, which was $20 more a night, but when you took into consideration that the other hotel did not charge any mandatory fees, it was only about $12 more a night and worth every last penny plus some! We were with a large group of travelers and this hotel was the joke of the trip, â€œSo how bad is your room?â€� When we told people we switched hotels, they were so jealous of us!

Reviews.Title: “Not sure”
Reviews.Author: Hog1
Reviews.Content: We booked for 3 nights in March 2009, mainly because of price. The rooms are clean and ok overall. I might have disliked the RSC more but we were only in the room for very brief periods. As far as bang for the buck it served its purpose. There are other hotels in the immedaite vicinity and in the quarter which are just as economical and with better service, amenities, valet. The location is good with a trolley stop literally outside. Do not valet if you will need you car at a moments notice.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, mediocre service, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: NaturallyGauche
Reviews.Content: Before going to NO on a business trip I researched this hotel on this and other travel websites. The biggest downside seemed to be service. I figured that I wouldn't be in the hotel all that much and wouldn't have an issue. I understand what the previous reviewers meant by poor service, but I also think that they might be overexaggerating. While I did find the front desk staff to be slow to respond, I also did not find them to be surly or rude. More than anything, I found them to be a bit undertrained and understaffed. If you can get over a small wait on check-in and check-out, I think you will be pleased with this hotel. The location couldn't be better if you are wanting to be in the thick of things but yet a little off the most crazy areas. My room was nice. Although, there were quite a few cigarette burns on the TV cabinet from previous guests. But then again, this is New Orleans and the clientele can be somewhat . . . let's say polluted at times and may not always remember their manners. All in all I was very pleased and found this hotel to be a very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price!!”
Reviews.Author: latstew
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great for the money. Very good location, straight shot to Harrah's casino and 1 block from Bourbon St. Don't expect 5 star accommodations but a nice room at a great price. Front desk clerk, Gabby knows a lot of great places to see, just ask. Bellman was very nice, I left my group and I needed to go to the store but was afraid to go alone at night, the bellman walked with me. Everyone was very nice and the hotel was clean and tidy at a great price. We had 3 rooms for 6 people and no one had any complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended! Unsafe!”
Reviews.Author: garry s
Reviews.Content: The most frightening thing was when the fire alarm went off at 2am. After walking down the stairway, I found that people were milling around in the lobby. The staff were ignoring the situation and the club on the ground floor was still pumping out ear-splitting dance music. Two of the 3 front doors were blocked/locked as they were the entire time I stayed there. After the fire department came, it was verified to be a false alarm but the total lack of responsibility of the staff was frightening!

Reviews.Title: “Great for Weekend Get Away”
Reviews.Author: jbooth2099
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night out of our Valentines weekend get away. We found a great price that included parking and that was our main reason for trying this place. The hotel was nice and all of the staff were helpful and friendly. This is a perfectg loaction for access to the Uptown parades during Mardi Gras. They all pass right in front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BestBargainShopper
Reviews.Content: This hotel was much better than we expected. We booked through itravel2000.com. As we live in Canada it was cheaper to pay in Canadian funds. We stayed 4 nights, from Feb 5 to Feb 9, 2009, and paid $400CDN. We booked a Deluxe Queen room and stayed in 802. Initially we were 819 but it was an interior room with a glass block wall that you couldn't see out. It was weird not knowing what's going on outside so we switched. The rooms are small but perfect for 2. The location was perfect! 2 minutes from Bourbon St and a very safe area. The staff were great! I don't know what other reviewers are complaining about. There is a daily resort fee of $6.95 and valet parking is $28 a day but all hotels in that area charge the same. When we booked with Itravel2000.com we were given free parking. We brought proof of the offer by printing the page just in case as others have complained about not getting it but we never had to show it. On Saturday night at 3am we were woken by very load people in the hallway but before we knew it security was there. The only negative thing I can say is that the "light continental breakfast" the hotel website talks about is non-existent during the week. They do have coffee all week but the danishes and muffins don't come out until the weekend. I would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Very good for the price”
Reviews.Author: junebugg02
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly and helpful. Both check-in and check-out were efficient. We were even allowed to check in 3 hours early! The staff had good suggestions about places to eat and how to get around New Orleans. The room was small, but adequate - bed not too comfortable, but OK for a couple of days. No microwave or mini fridge. The website lists "lite continental Breakfast," but actually, there is only coffee in the lobby. That's OK - plenty of places to eat in New Orleans, but it should not be listed on the website if it isn't there. Overall, a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: cajunsmiley
Reviews.Content: The service was really slow and unprofessional. Was told when I arrived that there was a mandatory 7.95$ fee and that valet parking was 26.00 a night. The lounge downstairs was so loud that you could hear it through the floor. The toilet was backed up when we got in the room and fixtures where dangling from the wall. There was screaming and banging throughout the night down the hallways. When the frontdesk was notified they did nothing about it. We had reserved a room for 3 people and was only given a room with one queen bed. DONT BELIEVE THAT RUN OF THE HOUSE ROOM IS WHATEVER YOU WANT IT IT IS WHAT THEY GIVE YOU. I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL TO ANYONE. YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED IF YOU READ THIS REVIEW.

Reviews.Title: “Had a blast”
Reviews.Author: cheapskateTx
Reviews.Content: No major problems. Only main concern was that we booked a "suite". It was not a suite. It was a rather small, one room, one bath but did have a small balcony. Coffee in room. Cold muffins in lobby. Room was clean. Location is on corner of St. Charles, one block to Canal Street to enter French Quarter. St. Charles is called Royal when you enter the Quarter. Helpful concerige who helped us book a tour, and bell hop who arranged cab back to airport. Good restaurant next door for lunch, and great little cafe opposite side of the block for working class breakfast. This is a decent, newly remodeled hotel within walking distance of many attractions.

Reviews.Title: “What ever happend to Customer service”
Reviews.Author: KCPirate
Reviews.Content: My company booked this property on line for me at what I thought was a good price that included parking, a $26.00 value. Upon arrival (after finding a valet who told me to leave my car where they were giving tickets) After finally getting a receipt for my rental car I checked in and was told of the mandatory charge for the business center , internet and safe. $7.95 I was told that I hade to pay it. After getting to my room and finding that the trash was full and the alarm clock not working I informed the front desk about the 2 minor problems and was told that no one was available to empty the trash and the had no other alarms. (once again no sorry sir) When checking out the next morning I experienced the young lady at the front desk was letting her friends come in and help themselves to coffee and croissants. The I proceeded to check out and was to be charged for parking and two days instead of one. After that I started to look for the valet, that was no where to be found. I informed the inattentive young lady at the front desk and she phoned him. When he showed up I told him what I drove and ticket number after 10-15 minuets he called the front desk and asked for the number again, then what car I drove again. After a total of 40 minuets my car showed up. Iâ€™m sure happy that my airline could find where they parked the plane that day. Do not stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: ndstrukt
Reviews.Content: After reading all of the negative reviews, I was hesitant to book a room. However, I just couldn't beat the $53 rate (with free parking) for New Year's Eve found on bookit.com, so I decided to take the risk. I'm so glad I did! Everyone was extremely friendly, from the valet driver to the woman at the check-in desk. I had a room w/ a king bed on the the 6th floor, with a direct view of St. Charles Avenue. The room looked brand new (or at least newly renovated)! The bed/bedding were new, the bathroom was all new w/ marble countertops and brand new tile floors, and the decor was new. Also, there is a bar called OHM in the lobby which also appeared to be brand new, very modern and hip. I couldn't have been more pleased with my visit.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Pleased”
Reviews.Author: originalladyleo4life
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the other reviews, I was somewhat nervous about staying here but I couldn't pass up the price for this location (1 block from the French Quarter) and went down there with my fingers crossed. I must say that I had an overall pleasing stay at this hotel. Front desk staff was very good. The check-in was relatively quick. On one of the days, a clerk suggested we take a van tour of the city and gave us a discounted rate. The tour was excellent (VIP tours) and I would suggest taking it if you have the time. Check-out was also quick and clerk called us a cab that was there almost as soon as she hung up the phone. Housekeeping was OK. One time, they didn't leave complete towel sets and another day, they didn't come to the room at all. Yes--the room was small but it was nice decorated & the bed was comfortable. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Who Dat?”
Reviews.Author: Vegas_Shopper
Reviews.Content: Being a Saints fan, my wife and I made a stop in New Orleans on our way to Mexico for a much needed vacation. We chose the Royal St. Charles for the location and the advertised promotions on their website. The hotel was just a few blocks from Bourbon Street and near the superdome. Staff was friendly and the room was comfortable. We had a great time and will definitely stay there again, hopefully during this football season.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad....”
Reviews.Author: rockinmomFL
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel one night. We drove from out of town and got lost finding the hotel. The receptionist was very rude when we called for directions. Thankfully we found an EMT who was gracious and able to give us directions. Double beds are not very big. Beds were very comfortable, but my husband took up most of the bed. Walls very thin. Valet guys were very nice. Clean room. Nice bathroom. Hotel is near everything.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Customer Service - never again”
Reviews.Author: JustAn0therTraveler
Reviews.Content: We went to New Orleans for a weekend with friends. New Orleans was great, the hotel was awful. â€¢ When we arrived they could only find one of the two rooms we had reserved (good thing we had the confirmation number). Once they found the second room we were informed that other people had been waiting while they were looking so we would need to go to the back of the line if we wanted to be checked in for the second room. â€¢ Our package gave us 50% off parking at the hotel when we arrived they no longer had any parking â€“ we ended up paying three times as much and parking in a ramp down the street â€¢ The â€œnon-smokingâ€� rooms we had reserved smelled like smoke and one of the rooms had a wet spot on the floor and smelled like someone had gone to the bathroom. â€¢ Our package offered a free harbor cruise â€“ we asked about the cruise several times and none of the hotel clerks had any idea how we could take advantage of the cruise. But at the same time they told us they had no idea how we could take advantage of the cruise they handed us a sheet for next monthâ€™s package offering the same cruise in a new package. This hotel had horrible customer service and was not clean. Take a vacation to New Orleans youâ€™ll love it, but donâ€™t stay and the Royal Saint Charles!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Ever”
Reviews.Author: maryjorleans
Reviews.Content: WORST HOTEL EVER! Well when we got there they had no double rooms available and the clerk was sassy as if it were our fault, we had a conformation number to prove we booked two double beds. They offered us a single room with a roll away bed, and would change us the next night and comp. us our parking. While we unload our luggage to our barely there room, what kind of roll-away bed you ask.....it was a twin size air mattress, which there wasn't any room for our luggage and an air mattress all in the same room. When were done I ask the guy to valet park my car and he then tells me there aren't any more spots in the parking garage for the hotel. But I was more then welcome to park my brand new car out on the street of New Orleans. I said well I should guess not! Went back in the hotel to speak to the front desk and it's now a guy no longer the sassy girl. He offers us to park at a hotel down the block, and bring back the receipt and when I check out they will refund my parking in cash! Well when we check out we get the sassy girl who checked us in and she refused to refund me my money for parking and said I needed a manager to do so, not to mention she has NO people skills! So I have to leave the hotel and call the manager the next day! And on top of all that, the lounge in the hotel is smokey and plays very loud music! And I hope you don't have to call for towels or anything from house keeping because they took over an hour and a half to bring towels to us, TWICE! Three elevators in the hotel and ONE worked! Believe me this hotel wasn't worth the time or money I spent there. They either need new management or just lock the doors.........It took me 3 days and lots of phone calls and a huge hassle with sassy employees, and manager to get my parking compted as promised. The manager would not return my phone calls or voice mail messages. WoW how to handle your position!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for the price- no problems”
Reviews.Author: dixienj
Reviews.Content: Despite some of the reviews this is a good hotel for a great price with their summer special. We checked in on a Thursday afternoon and requested a non smoking king room. The room was fine except it smelled heavily of cigarette smoke. A quick call to the front desk and we went down and we switched to another room. The front desk clerk was very nice about it and the second room was fine. Overall the room was clean, the bathroom modern and clean and the decor was nice. The room is somewhat small but for the price and location it was fine. We really did not spend a lot of time in the room. The hotel is within walking distance to french quarter, casino, shopping and other attractions with two streetcars right there to take you other places. Facilities fee and parking were clear on the website and explained at check in. Coffee and danish breakfast was limited and fine with fresh fruit also offered. No complaints. We have stayed at resorts and hotels ranging from 3-5 stars while traveling and this is somewhere in between. This would have been considered off season and not real busy but I would recommend this hotel to travelers for the price. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel, wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: mikes_sister_toronto
Reviews.Content: The Royal St. Charles was a great value for the price. You'll find the best booking deals directly from their website (I was there the first week of April, only paid $55/night!). The room was clean, the staff were nice and very helpful, Leonard at the front desk was especially lovely. Located only one block away from Canal St and the French Quarter, this hotel is ideally situated - close to all the action, but far enough away from the noise of Bourbon St (trust me, there's lots of noise!). The St Charles street car stops right outside the hotel, I highly recommend taking it out to see the mansions in the Garden District. It's a nice, scenic ride that's only $1.25 each way (and about 1.5 hours round trip). My friend and I grabbed a snack and enjoyed a relaxing (and cheap) afternoon. The $55/night included breakfast, though it's just coffee and a small danish. Great if you want to grab a quick sugar and caffeine fix before heading out, but most days I didn't bother as there are a lot of nice places to eat at. Contrary to what others have said, there IS a place to sit and eat in the lobby, they just don't have proper tables and chairs, but who cares? Are you there to eat in the hotel, or sight see?? Worst case scenario, you can just take it back to your room. There's also a small gym (only one working treadmill), and a computer with internet access. So, all in all, a very good deal for the price (sorry to those who booked with another website and paid way more). I had a wonderful time in New Orleans, and I look forward to going back someday. Every one in the city is so friendly, go and see for yourself! :-)

Reviews.Title: “My New Orleans Secret”
Reviews.Author: Vacationgirl101
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. I booked it when i attended the Essence Music Festival last July. Since i did not rent a car it was perfect because the hotel is walking distance to all the events. Just a block away from the trolley and a couple of blocks from Bourbon Street. I like the idea that the hotel is a couple of blocks away because you get your peace and quiet. There is also a lounge in the lobby and the sound of the music did not enter the room at all. Free breakfast in the morning also kept costs down. The hotel is located in a safe area and staff was very helpful. I will stay here everytime i visit the area. In fact i will be there this year for Essence fest again!

Reviews.Title: “Best spot in New Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: newmom2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel in May of '08 and had a ball! The hotel is conveniently located near the French Quarters, the Aquarium and walking distance from Bourbon Street. The room was comfortable for two people, had nice amenities and housekeeping was pretty thorough. Bellboys were especially helpful as they both parked cars and answered any questions we had about the area and area events. I'd definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Robbed by Hotel Staff”
Reviews.Author: Brangwen
Reviews.Content: We were guests at this hotel the night of 5/18/08. Our hotel room was entered by a hotel master key and several expensive electronic items were removed... these items were NOT sitting out, they were packed into our luggage as we were preparing to check out and leave New Orleans. We had packed up and headed down the street to grab breakfast before checking out. We returned to find things opened and missing. These items were not left out in plain site, our luggage was rummaged through. A police officer was onsite within 30 min (which we had to call) to take the report. The front desk manager (Gabby) was very rude during the whole process. We were informed by her and "Aurthur" that they had to do a lock check... apparently this takes 3+ hours to do (???). At least 4 to 5 times during this process (waiting on the lock check and dealing with the police) we overheard her talking with housekeeping via radio if room "402" was vacated yet to so they could flip it. Very odd that the MANAGER on duty doesn't seem to recognize which room # was just broken into and the guests from that room are standing in front of her. She never seemed to recognize us each time we returned to the front desk. As we wait, we discover at least one other room was robbed (9th floor) and the lady we spoke with was just as upset about the treatment by the hotel staff as we were. My guess is there were several more rooms hit, the guests had not returned yet to find items missing. It is now 2 days later and the General Manager of the hotel will not return phone calls, although she did tell us yesterday that the lock check DID show it was a hotel master key that accessed our room.

Reviews.Title: “really really bad”
Reviews.Author: kkap2001
Reviews.Content: When my husband and I arrived we were given a room without a window.. The room had no window!!!! It would never occur to me when paying $230.00 a night in the US to ask if the room had a window. They wouldn't transfer us that night, all full. They did transfer us the next night. I think all the rooms with 2 double beds have no window. Fortunately our third person ended up not coming so we could change to a room with one double bed. None of their information tells you that some rooms have no windows. I think at this hotel we found the only cold, unfriendly people in all New Orleans. And when you leave, they tell you there's a mandatory $6.95 a night charge for the phone, whether you use the phone or not. This is also not listed on the hotels.com information. For people who are bothered by noise, there is loud construction in the street and a loud bar that's part of the lobby. Avoid this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place. A Real Bargain.”
Reviews.Author: JacksonGuy
Reviews.Content: The Royal St Charles is a very nice place. The selling point - handsdown - is the price. During Jazzfest, my wife and I booked a weekend room here for less than 1/4th comparable hotels in the area. The location is very nice. Corner of Canal and St Charles. One block of Bourbon. Room was suprisingly large, with huge wall of windows. Breakfast "buffet" was just coffee and danishes, but was free, so cant complain. We have now stayed three times here, and will definitely return. Perfect for a nice, clean, and very inexpensive bed. I give a big thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Royal St. Charles was a great find and wonderful location!”
Reviews.Author: iamcarson
Reviews.Content: We made arrangements for us and 3 friends to go to Jazz Fest this year and just before our trip found the terrible reviews of this hotel. We were terrified of what we - and our friends - were going to find! We found the hotel to be wonderful! All of our 3 rooms were nice and clean and had windows and everything worked well. New Orleans has plenty of dingy hotels but this was not one of them. Maybe the rooms across the hall didn't have windows but all of ours were great. One thing we agreed with from the unfavorable reviews was the bogus wi-fi charge. None of us used the service but we were all charged a daily fee for it. And I did hear someone say that it didn't work well. But the location of this hotel to the French Quarter was ideal (just a block off Canal Street) and we discovered some new restaurants in the Warehouse district. One good one in the Quarter is EAT - at 900 Dumaine Street. You get great deals on non-fried food and it's BYOB! There's a small grocery with a huge wine selection one block away! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Awful.”
Reviews.Author: kyeoj1926
Reviews.Content: In all of the times that I've traveled, I've never experienced more incompetence than when I stayed at the Royal St. Charles. The "managers" gave our room away twice and suggested that four people share one bed. The rooms were also windowless, small, stained, and falling apart. Further, danishes and coffee do not equate a "full American breakfast." Although the location was great, the hotel experience was awful. Think twice before choosing this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “just ok”
Reviews.Author: gorditer
Reviews.Content: this is a very inexpensive hotel. i came for a conference rate of $99 but i saw others checking in at $55 a night. it has a great internet/phone package (unlimited calls and internet for $6.95 a day). i found the staff to be helpful. don't expect anything from the rooms however. they are small and dark - mine did not have a window! when was the last time you had a room without a window. the bathroom was small. the linens were dingy. bed was comfortable enough. for the price i would stay again but this is not a boutique hotel as it claims.

Reviews.Title: “Valet parking gave us a parking fine!!!!”
Reviews.Author: BeautyJ
Reviews.Content: The room was very small and dark. We park valet and month later have got a fine from City New Orleans Parking Violations Bureau. We have to pay $40 dollars fine for it.The manager of the hotel Michell Russo was not helpful at all. She gave me a bad attitude and saying that it is was not them but i have the date and time of the fine and it was after 5 minutes we checked in. I still fighting to get my money back. If you can stay some other hotel please do that. Stay away from the trouble and parking fines.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but small”
Reviews.Author: malia311
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the RSC for 311 Day with 2 of my friends. We got a special rate of $90/day and for that price it was worth it. It was clean and the beds were comfortable but the room & bathroom are both very small!! It's worth staying here if you get a good deal and there's not more than 3 people in the room. Also if you plan on hanging out in your room for a long time, this is not the place to stay. It was good for getting ready to go out and sleeping. Location is very convenient, the french quarter is a short walking distance away and there's a street car stop right in front of the hotel. The staff was very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: thephunkster2001
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for our anniversary from Feb 28-Mar 2. I must say that the trip and the stay at this hotel was wonderful! On the day we got in, I was nervous because the bed frame wasn't not fitted in the headboard, which created a sinking in the middle of the bed. However, we called and a tech promptly came and fixed the problem. All was well from that point forward. I have to also give a special mention to the front desk person named GABBIE. She was the most pleasant and helped us tremendously in all areas of stay! She, as well as the whole staff we encountered, was excellent! We will stay there again very soon!

Reviews.Title: “The stay was awesome, room were quaint!!!!”
Reviews.Author: AmyDaveWI
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a nice placeand we enjoyed our stay, for the price of the hotel it is worth it. I would recommend this hotel. It was not a 5 star but in New Orleans there is so much to see that you won't spend alot of time in the hotel. Thanks for a great trip in the big New Orleans. from Wisconsin

Reviews.Title: “Good property”
Reviews.Author: Renee081
Reviews.Content: I booked this property same day, I was visiting a friend who fell ill and I decided to spend the night in New Orleans. I booked through Bookit, It took a phone call to ensure I had a confirmation due to booking a few hours in advance. The hotel location is good, within easy walking distance to the French Quarter and Harrahs and there's a St. Charles streetcar stop out front. It had very easy access to the expressway (I10). Lobby is small, but nice. The lobby bar was not open during my stay (Sunday night), but it looked nice. The hotel offers valet parking - NOTE: The parking is around 10 minutes away. When you're claiming your car, plan for 20-30 minutes to get it back, depending on traffic. My room was small (typical of an older hotel), but clean. The bedding was very nice. Carpet could use replacing. They had a very nice lit built-in vanity area. Iron / ironing board in the room. Bathroom was nice, just very little counter space due to the small size. Front desk staff was pleasant and courteous. There are no restaurants on site. They charge a $6.95 resort fee for use of the fitness center and business center. Business center had one computer and a printer, but it was sufficient and allowed me to check in at work. Fitness center has 2 treadmills and a crossramp plus some weight equipment. I couldn't get the crossramp to work and one of the treadmills seemed to be out of commission. But I was still able to use the second treadmill. I was still pleased with this hotel and got a great rate. If the price were right, I would consider staying here again. You're in the room so little, it doesn't matter how big it is and I thought the location was great.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: chitowntraveler83
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during NBA Allstar Weekend after having problems with another hotel. It was amazing! The room had a king sized bed, couch, table, and desk. Yes, the bathroom was small, but this wasn't home--it served it's purpose (tastefully decorated with granite by the way). There is a lounge on the first floor of the hotel in case you want to relax before going out. One of the best hotels I have stayed at...it's the perfect location...away from the noise but still in the middle of the action. Coming back for the Essence Music Festival...room is already booked there!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible stay!”
Reviews.Author: akadiva24
Reviews.Content: The hotel floors were filthy. The hotel management was rude and uncooperative. The hotel management had us move from the connecting rooms we requested and paid for to two rooms that were not connecting because they had a water leak in the room above us. We were out in the city when they called and asked us to to return to the hotel to pack and move our belongings to another room. This caused us to have to leave our meal and cancel plans to tour the city. When we asked the hotel for some sort of credit for our inconvenience the management became rude and unprofessional and threatened to put us out of the hotel! Not only that, one of the rooms hey moved us to did not have a working smoke detector (it was hanging from the wall), but the linens and the curtains were filthy! This was a terrible experience and I do not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Mardis Gras!”
Reviews.Author: wakeluvr
Reviews.Content: Okay, so it's not the Ritz but this cozy boutique hotel was the perfect place for us to experience Mardis Gras. The location is awesome, right on the parade route which made it super easy for us to take bathroom breaks from "bead catching" and beer downing. Parking is a challenge and expensive but, the rate we got for the hotel was good enough that we could swing it. It felt very safe and the staff was awesome. We are not very demanding though and pretty easy to please. Hotel could use a little TLC but it was more than adequate for what we needed. We have already booked there again for next year!

Reviews.Title: “Better Then Expected”
Reviews.Author: FrugalTraveler50
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel it be a great find. The lobby entrance is actually on Common St. around the corner from the bar entrance. The staff at the front desk were friendly and check-in went smoothly. My room was on the 8th floor. The elevator and the hallways were clean and bright. While my room wasn't large, it wasn't the smallest room I have ever stayed in and with a glass wall that overlooked St. Charles Ave., it was surprisingly very quiet. The room was comfortable and clean. It may have been refurbished recently. The bathroom was the same. Good water pressure and plenty of hot water. The clip that held the hairdryer in it's base had been broken but it worked just fine. The TV had a variety of stations plus pay-per-view options. I never head noise from the adjoining rooms my entire stay. Mini muffins/danish and coffee are served in the lobby each morning. There really wasn't any place to sit so you either went back to your room, stood in the lobby or took it to go. There was a resort fee of $6 but added to the $63 daily room rate still made the my stay a bargain. Being a block off of Canal St. the hotel is easy walking distance to many attractions and the French Quarter. The streetcar stop is on the corner in case you want to explore the Garden District and beyond. I would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Emerald76
Reviews.Content: We arrived later in the evening. The lobby was a little loud from the music in the lounge, making it hard to hear the front desk clerk, but check-in was otherwise easy. The room was very small, but recently updated and the beds were comfortable with down comforters and feather pillows. Everything was very clean and quiet. (We were on the 6th floor) We walked 1 block to supper at Shula's (spendy but WONDERFUL!) and in the morning we walked 1 block into the French Quarter for breakfast at Petunia's (again - wonderful food!) I would stay here again if it were a trip with just my husband & I.

Reviews.Title: “return visit to New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: easttexas43
Reviews.Content: O.K. for the budget vacationer on foot. $47.99 a night, Dec. 18-20. Breakfast is sweet rolls & coffee. No juice, tea, or hot chocolate. Not handy if you don't already know your way around Canal St. & the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the price”
Reviews.Author: rgs258
Reviews.Content: Booked on bookit.com; very easy. There is nothing bad about this hotel. It has a gym and a computer w/ printer also (good to print your boarding pass). The hotel is missing things that make others hotels more expensive (a restaurant, room service, etc.) Close to french quarter.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Royal St. Charles!”
Reviews.Author: OMEXICO
Reviews.Content: My husband met me here after my convention, and we stayed 3 nights. The location was terrific, just a short walk to the streetcar on Canal St. The staff was extremely helpful, calling cabs for us, and giving tourist info. The room was beautiful, with a fabulous view of the city and river. The bed was exceptionally comfortable, and we really enjoyed our stay. You cannot beat the location!

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Ms_MImi17
Reviews.Content: The room was small but nice. The elevator, however, did break down on our 2nd night there and we had to use to stairs for the remainder of our stay. Enjoyed the bar downstairs and loved the hotel's close proximity to Bourbon St. The valet parking was the worst thing about the hotel. Sometimes it would take as long as 45 minutes to get our car. Other than that, it was a great stay for the price.

Reviews.Title: “For this price, can't go wrong”
Reviews.Author: tfleming75
Reviews.Content: For the very reasonable price, this hotel was more than expected. The staff was very friendly and helpful and it is within 2 blocks of Bourbon Street. The only drawback was the breakfast buffet--it consisted of danish and coffee-no hot water for tea, but each room does have a coffee/tea maker. The room is perfect for 2 people--any more any you would be crowded. I would definitely stay in this hotel again if going back to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Place”
Reviews.Author: Wbalsamo
Reviews.Content: I called the hotel and made a reservation for a king non smoking room and even got a confirmation email. When I arrived they lost my reservation and couldn't pull it up with the confirmation number. I used their business office to print the email and the printer took 20 min to print it. After that, the manager swiped my card and said I had a King size room , this was at 2pm but wouldn't let anyone check in til 4... I left to go eat, watch football, have some drinks... came back at 11pm to check in and the bar in the lobby was so loud that I couldn't here the clerk to handle any business... I get to my room and it has 2 DOUBLE BEDS.... AFTER I WAS GAURENTEED A KING JUST HOURS BEFORE... They put us in a King suite after I made an issue about it. He said he had to juggle reservations... and I said I had a reservation.. I swear.. I made more of an effort to get in the right room than anyone that worked at that hotel... When I first walked in... I think i interrupted the guy surfing the web and he did very little to help me with my reservation that they lost... I might understand had I book it through some website... but I called them directly... My room was dirty and the drapes didn't even cover the whole window so light came in the room all night.... they discounted the room 30 dollars which might have covered the tax... I know I spent the better part of 2 hours of my weekend dealing with this and moving my stuff twice. I WILL NEVER STAY HERE AGAIN... AND DO NOT RECOMMEND IT

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, Ive had better though”
Reviews.Author: Sublimebrad
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights. I have stayed at other Clarion boutique hotels in the city before and they were all great. The reason I stayed here this time was because of the price ($49 a night during the week) and the location (1 block from french quarter). The room was decent but the bed wasnt very comfy. It looks like they have done some remodeling but the furniture is old and stained which takes away from the additions they had done. They had a free breakfast in the morning which consisted of apple juice and a pastry each day. No other choices. The staff wasnt very friendly at all except for the valet guys who were nice. Parking is $15 a day valet only and sometimes takes a while to get your car back in the morning. The hotel has a very nice trendy bar but there was no happy hour and the drinks were way overpriced compared to the rest of the city. You can go one block over and get cheap drinks in the quarter. I might stay here again if Im on a budget and the other rooms are booked but it wouldnt be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Room!”
Reviews.Author: RobinRRT
Reviews.Content: We were in NO for a MSU/Tulane football game. We booked this hotel because of the location and the rates. Our room was a fabulous corner room- which I will always ask for in the future. Two walls were all windows with a nice view. The decor was very attractive, and the bed had a down comforter and a very thick and comfortable mattress pad. Our room was unusual in the layout, which made it so likeable. It had a sitting room and around the corner was the bedroom. The hotel is located only 1-2 blocks from the French Quarter and about 3 blocks to Bourbon St. We were actually able to walk to the Super Dome to the football game. It was about 8-10 blocks. Afterwards we took a taxi, which was inexpensive. Overall New Orleans seemed very safe. We walked all throughout the French Quarter during the day time and down Bourbon St. at night. We never felt that we were in any danger. There were plenty of tourist as well as NO police and the Guardian Angels. The only negative comment I would have about the hotel was that the breakfast buffet was very ordinary. I have had better at lesser hotels. The front desk staff were very nice, as well as the valets. There is no pool or restaurant at this hotel, but our room was one of the nicest I have stayed in throughout the south.

Reviews.Title: “Sad!!!”
Reviews.Author: panaceaNewOrleans
Reviews.Content: went to enjoy a dj show in the lounge, purchased a few drinks in cash then decided to use credit. The bartender rang me up for not just the drink purchased but also for the drinks that were previously purchased!!! After pointing out the mistake, the bartender (one of three, not even the one who had served me) insisted I was wrong and insisted I pay for the drinks. She said she was willing to take off a drink! WOW, I get to pay for product not even consumed! Worst part is the bartender was tipped over 25% or more per round! Absolutely disgusting, one can't even enjoy a night out in post Katrina NOLA without geting ripped off!!! Shame!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Convenient, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: DUIguy
Reviews.Content: The small clean room was attractively and relatively recently decorated, with cable TV and refrigerator. My ninth floor view included a little of the Great Mississippi. The $6 mandatory resort fee included breakfast, room safe, unlimited local and long-distance calls, wireless Internet, and a discount for valet parking. The room cost was an excellent bargain at about $50 per night, including the resort fee and taxes. The location is superb, with many shops and restaurants nearby. It's only a block from the French Quarter. It took a while for hot water to flow to the bathroom spigots. Half of the folding closet door was missing. A long stretch of the ninth floor hallway had the carpet removed. On request, my alarm clock was promptly replaced and the room safe electronic controls were reset. The breakfast was cold cereal, yogurt, rolls and danish, fruit juice, milk, and coffee. I was denied a late checkout. In my haste, I left car keys, a calendar, and other small items in the desk at about 11 am, when I checked out. I phoned about that around 6 pm and was told nothing had been reported as missing. Only the housekeeping department had access to the lost and found and wasn't supposed to be available until the next morning. I phoned housekeeping the next morning, as directed, and left a message, which was never returned. Same on the following day. Finally, Donald Price of the front desk got back to me with the recovered items. At my request and expense, he sent them to me by UPS. All arrived the next day, to my delight.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, But a Lot of Drawbacks!”
Reviews.Author: JJMoneyMan
Reviews.Content: While advertising itself as a boutique hotel, this one isn't nearly as chic as the mainstream boutique properties. The rooms are nice but small, the alarm clock may or may NOT work, and the wait for the valet to retrieve your car from the garage (a block away) can be up to a half-hour or more - leaving anxious guests who are trying to make it to the airport on time! They charge a "resort" free of about $6 a day upon check-in, largely to pay for a really bad continental breakfast. The property is nonsmoking, with the only place to smoke being outside, or at night in their bar that really blasts the music!! Also, the wireless internet connection is slow at best. For a cheap place to stay within a short walk of the French Quarter, I would deem it okay - but VERY inconvenient if you have a rental car and want to be on the go, due to the slow valet service, and your car being locked in a garage.

Reviews.Title: “do not stay there”
Reviews.Author: travel_lover33
Reviews.Content: Went to check in and was told that we were not in the computer. Even though we had the paper work. They were no help. Ask to speak to the manager and was told there was none on duty. Were told that the manager would call us and we never heard back. We were lucky to find another hotel to stay in. DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel for a small price!”
Reviews.Author: Diane_SFlorida
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful , luxury hotel for the small price. Staff was all very pleasant and went beyond efforts to make the stay a wonderful experiance. I had booked a king size bed non smoking room originally but ended up bringing my 19 yr old son along. The front desk clerk gave me a room with two beds at no extra charge. I was amazed but then she went on to inform me the there was a daily resort fee of an additonal , I think , $9.95 aday in which I questioned. She told me it was for phone use and wireless internet access. I told her I didn't have a computer with me so she waved that fee also. :) Now let me tell you about the room. It was gorgeous!!!!!!! Modern art on the walls, feather bed pads and comforters, extreme clean every corner and then the bathroom....WOW.....one of the nicest I have seen ...even in a much more expensive hotel. The location was great and within walking distance to everything or at least to the street car lines if you are not a walker. My stay was a wonderful experiance and I had not even got to telling you about the wonderful things to do in New Orleans....:)

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: uberblonde
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable room, although the carpet was old/stained. found the staff to be helpful (if stretched a bit thin). They were very accommodating with my rented bike and holding bags before/after check-in.

Reviews.Title: “can't go wrong”
Reviews.Author: edingtonjim
Reviews.Content: This place was a little gem to find for anyone who loves to pop into New Orleans for a few days of fun. If you know Boutique hotels, you know it means "no frills", and at the price, we weren't expecting much. when we arrived the place was trendy, clean, and the staff was great. the valet, however, was a little less than efficient to say the least, but the place is within walking distance to everything in the quarter and along the river walk. The rooms were clean and well taken care of, and the beds even had down comforters -- NOT the usuall boutique hotel stuff. We caught Joe, the manager, in the hall way to ask some questions and he took time out to take us around the hotel and explain some the lesser known points and nightspots in the city. we recommend this place to anyone not expecting to pull up into the ritz for under 100 bucks a night.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: ShawnGlenpool
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was the best. I plan on going to New Orleans often and I will stay at the Royal St. Charles every time. I can't wait till my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “stuffy room, good hotel if you like form over function”
Reviews.Author: ultranomad
Reviews.Content: First impression of hotel on ground floor was: "artsy with a party atmosphere" -- bar on first floor is a very cool design, all staff were friendly and attentive. The only option for parking was valet, which was a bit slow, but the hotel location is right next to the French Quarter, so access to your car is only important if you want to explore other areas of the city, such as the Garden District. The room I got was nice looking with a very comfortable bed. Bad part: room was stuffy (the windows don't open -- my ultimate pet peeve in a hotel), air conditioning is centralized and didn't work very well (I had it cranked all the way down). The room smelled intensely like paint -- this in combination with poor ventilation made for poor sleep and insomnia -- I checked out the next morning. This hotel would be good for people who don't mind sleeping in a stuffy, paint-smelling room.

Reviews.Title: “A brief but nice stay.”
Reviews.Author: Coder
Reviews.Content: I found this establishment while researching hotels near the New Orleans Amtrak station. I had never been to the city before and just wanted to stay near the station to catch a connecting train home the next day. I have to say not a bad stay at all. I came in right after the Jazz Festival ended and got a room for the night for $69.00. The area seemed a bit questionable at first but the next day I was able to stroll around down to the nearby French Quarter and Riverwalk before I left. The area is old but historic and my room was not too bad. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was clean as a whistle. The only thing was that there was no coffee pot on the in-room coffee maker and with taxes and the resort fee the bill was bumped up to $99.00. I only spent one night but I was very comfortable and it was very easy to get a taxi back to the train station the next day so would I stay here again? If I needed a room at the last minute - sure.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: sublime1970
Reviews.Content: In terms of an economy botique ethos, Royal St. Charles has some attributes: feather top beds, immaculate high thread count linens, great location for the Quarter. I booked a room on Kayak.com for the night before the Sugar Bowl a month in advance for just over a hundred. Of course parking will set you back another $30 a day (plus tip) & a mandatory internet/phone fee of $10. My WIFI couldn't get a signal (& I was on the top floor, usually the lower ones have weak connections.) The front desk clerk refunded that fee when I asked. I parked the car in a garage down the block for only $15 for 24hrs. Of course I only had one small suitcase to roll for a couple hundred feet...but if you've got several pieces of luggage, you may have to pony up. If you can live w/the rooms being NYC small, you can get a decent deal at this place. P.S. Some business group in Istanbul currently owns this hotel so I had to pay an international conversion fee on my credit card for the charge, but it was less than $5.

Reviews.Title: “No window! stuck in a box with no window,mean management too”
Reviews.Author: MrsdeeNiagaraFalls
Reviews.Content: Our room was as big as my bathroom at home and get this...had no window!!!Just to find out what the weather was like I had to get dressed and go down to the lobby!We were prepared to let nothing stop us from having a great time,and we did....loved N.O....this place though--we asked to switch rooms and was told yes by a nice girl at front desk and then her mean boss came up behind her to tell her "no way".He treated my husband like he was stupid and looked like he was ready to get into an arguement,so we just left it.asked the next day and she said yes and promised us,so we thought we were good...I mean "promise"...nope,the mean guy laughed at us this time.So we were stuck in a little box with no window our entire stay.

Reviews.Title: “Will NEVER Stay at this Hotel Again!!!!”
Reviews.Author: yellowdriver
Reviews.Content: We prepaid for 3 rooms for two nights, 3/31 & 4/1. We called before leaving on Saturday morning to make sure we could get our rooms next to each other and were told that they would take care of it. We drove 9 1/2 hrs with a party of 10 and when we went to check in we were told that the hotel had overbooked and our rooms were not available. I could hardly believe my ears. They said they were sorry but just because we had a confirmed reservation and had already paid for our rooms, they were not available. They said they would comp us rooms in a different hotel for Saturday night but then we would have to return to their hotel on Sunday because they would have rooms available. When we went to the hotel they sent us to ( a Hampton) we were told they didn't have any double rooms either but after speaking with a manager, she was able to put us in 3 rooms that were set for rennovation and it ended up that these rooms were much larger and nicer than the ones we got at the Royal St. Charles. I spoke with the manager of the Royal St. Charles hotel when we came to check in on Sunday and he said that just because we had a guaranteed reservation it didn't mean that we had a room. What they ended up doing was sell our rooms for probably twice what we had paid online and then didn't care that we didn't have a place to stay except to send us to another hotel which they paid less money for. It was the worst experience I have ever had with any hotel stay. I wouldn't want anyone else to have to go through what we did and that's why I'm posting this.

Reviews.Title: “no problems”
Reviews.Author: navajo2km
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very clean and seemed relatively new. The bar in the lobby just re-opened. It was clean but seemed very boring. Not much going on at the hotel. The clerk at the front desk was helpful at night. The dayshift clerk didn't seem to care about ANYTHING. Overall it was worth the stay.

Reviews.Title: “will never stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: jbdaqueen
Reviews.Content: rooms were very small. housekeeping did a poor job. exhaust fan in bathroom so loud you could not even hear over it. no restaurant, bar only open in the evenings. overall did not like it, did not get my money's worth and will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service”
Reviews.Author: aaron613
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal St Charles for Mardi Gras 2007. The 2 rooms we booked were supposed to be doubles but instead were singles. No king bed, but full beds. The rooms were nice, but small. When I called the front desk about this mix-up in room type, the front desk told me "sorry, it's mardi gras" and offered to bring extra blankets. For $200/night/room they brought 1 extra pillow and 1 extra blanket to sleep on the floor. Totally unacceptable. Not only was the staff not helpful, but they bordered on rude and put out. Every time I asked for something (more blankets and more pillows, since we were sleeping on the floor) the front desk got huffy and acted put out. Who's the customer here?? For the money, you should stay at a different hotel, either one of the W Hotels would be much better.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal and good location”
Reviews.Author: memboy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a short and safe walk to the French Quarter. Check in was smooth and fairly quick. The clerk was friendly and helpful. The elevators were fast, and I never had to wait more than five to ten seconds for one. The room was somewhat small but attractive and cozy. The decor was modern and up to date. The room was sparkling clean and had a "new "smell. The mattress was very comfortable and had a feather top. There was a nice down comforter and plenty of pillows. The bathroom was very adequate. Neutrogena products (shampoo, conditioner, and lotion) were provided. The room description said robes were provided, but there was not one. The exhaust fan in the bathroom was loud and cranky. I could not hear a thing when it was on-- and it was impossible to turn off when I was in the bathroom as it came on automatically whenever the light was turned on. The coffee maker was a weird one-cup contraption with no pot. never really figured it out, and there were no instructions provided. The room had no window, but I did not require one. The breakfast buffet is continental-- several pastries and cereals and yogurts are offered as well as croissants and coffee and juices. The maid service was good. I returned to a clean and good smelling room every evening. The TV and remote worked very well. No fuzzy channels. The Thermostat was easy to control and climate control worked well. Checkout was fast and easy.

Reviews.Title: “New Orleans is back!”
Reviews.Author: gmg1130g
Reviews.Content: 1/30/2007 Gary Griffin-Columbus,Ga. My wife and I stayed two nights pre cruise and one night after our cruise .I found the hotel very nice and the people working there very cordial and pleasant to talk to.Many of these people had lost everything to hurricane Katrina yet they all were very pleasant.I would recommend this hotel to any one.They provide a very nice breakfast buffet.Close to French Quarters and many fine restaurants within walking distance.We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, but watch the "resort fee"!”
Reviews.Author: sneezySanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: The Royal St. Charles is in a good location next to the French Quarter. The rooms are small, but they were clean and I do not spend much time in the hotel room so that was okay. Their online price is good but they add on an additional $9.95 per day "resort fee" which angered me and all the other patrons in the hotel. When I called them about the resort fee they said it was not optional and it did not appear on expedia.com where I booked it but that it did appear on most of the others including theirs. That was a lie! I went back and checked orbitz and hotels.com and I even booked another night through the Royal St. Charles own website and I was still charged the extra $9.95 resort fee on top of they room fee of $69. If you stay there just be prepared and complain. Maybe they'll wise up. Even with the resort fee the room price is not bad for New Orleans and the staff was very nice and very patient with all of the complianing about the resort fee.

Reviews.Title: “Ripped off!”
Reviews.Author: gee_lady
Reviews.Content: Thought we found a great deal on Continental at $69 a night for an upscale New Orleans hotel, but we paid for it in the end. Continental apparently books third party through Travelocity, which we didn't find out until we arrived... then the "fees" started to add up. Continental pre-charged my cc for the $69, plus tax. What they don't tell you is that any "service fees" that "may" be extra are in fact mandatory fees. Upon arrival we ran into a "resort fee" of $9.95 and then an internet "booking fee" of $2.95 and then if you bring a car, be prepared to pay! The only reason we got a rental car was that the hotel was very reasonable. The car was $40 per day. If you want to park your car at the hotel, there is a mandatory "valet" parking fee of $29.12 per night!! Yes, per night!! That's almost as much as the car! They don't have their own parking lot and use a parking garage. We were told by the manager that we were not responsible to pay the resort fee since we booked online, but when we got home, it was on our cc! We never even signed anything! Also, when I called, they told me they would credit the $9.95, but it's been a week and no credit yet! Be careful where you go there, everything is extra. The online booking tools do not disclose these specific fees, so make sure you call the hotel before booking anything and ask for all the details. It will be a cold day when I deal with an internet booking tool again without investigating with the hotel first!! This particular hotel is normally about $119 per night. I think if you add the fees to the $69 "special", it's just about there. Also, the people are near impossible at the desk to squeeze a nickle back out of! They will really argue with you and bascially say it's your problem. What ever happened to the customer is always right?! Besides, you would think New Orleans would want to bring in business, not scare it away!!

Reviews.Title: “stay away from royal st charles”
Reviews.Author: christyb2006
Reviews.Content: It was my husbands birthday and a few of us got together to plan to stay and party in new orleans. So my husband chose for us to syay at the royal st charles. We arrived and checked in and the room seemed to be ok. The room had a mini bar (NOT). the mini bar was empty. Well ok no big deal right? So we all got dressed to go out on the town and called down to the front desk for them to bring us a roll-a-way bed for the room and they said they would.(NOT) They never brought one. so one of our guest slept on the floor. so the next day we called down for them to bring us one again and then they tell us they stopped using roll-a-way beds. so once again our guest slept on the floor. So we don't suggest staying there if theirs more the two people and they don't have alot of the stuff they say they have and they like to CHANGE THE PRICES WITHOUT TELLING YOU !!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Time in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Happy_2_Traveler
Reviews.Content: As per one of the other written reviews, the description of the room, and service was exactly described. The rooms were better than what I expected (feathered bedspreads), and the hotel service was super! The rooms were small, but this made it even cozier. I had no problems sleeping. I do have one correction to the other person's review about the coffee maker not having a pot. This mini-coffee maker was made to make 1-cup at a time. It was design to place a cup under the coffee-maker instead of a pot. The cups were near the coffee-maker. We spent 3 nights at the Royal St. Charles hotel, and loved every minute. The location was perfect (1 blk from Canal St), and 4 blks from Harrah's Casino. The crowds were small, which made it better for us (pushing a stroller with my granddaughter in it). Overall, we had a good time in New Orleans. My 3yr. old grand-daugrhter would wake up early in the morning, open the drapes, and say to us "wake up, It's a wonderful day!".

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Royal St. Charles during Jazz Fest 2006 and could not have made a better hotel selection. We booked online and got a real deal but even at their regular rates this hotel is a bargain. The location is perfect. We did not expect to have all the services available, as we assumed the hotel would be understaffed. But we were pleasantly surprised to receive maid service every day. The entire staff from front desk to valet and bartender were efficient and cordial. (and some of these folks lost everything they owned in Katrina). The rooms are small, as are most boutique hotels, but well decorated and spotless. I'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Falls very short of its description”
Reviews.Author: Tat8er
Reviews.Content: I found descriptions of this hotel at the hotel's website and at the Clarion by Choice's website. I made a reservation at the latter site. The disparity in the glowing descriptions versus the reality of the property would be funny if the price were not so expensive. Since a friend and I stayed at this hotel during Jazz Fest 2006 we paid a dear price, which had to be paid up front at the time of reservation, and our sense of humor was at a low point. If this hotel touted itself as a one- or two- star property, and charged accordingly, I would not have blinked. As it is, this hotel fancies itself as a luxurious boutique hotel. They claim to have "spacious rooms" but, as other reviewers have pointed out, the rooms are very compact. Our room had two double beds (and a window, which I hear is not always available). The beds were each against a wall, and the space between the beds was only wide enough for a bedside table. In other words, perhaps a meter between the beds. The desk was located at the end of the beds, with an armoire on each side. The space from the foot of the beds to the desk was probably three feet. Wide enough to maneuver as long as the armoire's doors or drawers were closed. The room was clean. Although it was labeled non-smoking there was a smoke aroma, probably from a shared venting system. We bought a scented candle and burned it while in the room, and that helped alot. The AC was powerful but came at a price. While the AC was running there was a loud high-pitched sound.
