At first we thought it was an alarm in the outside corridor, but when we investigated we discovered it was coming from our ceiling AC vent. We checked another room and found the same problem. Every time the cooling unit cycles off (every five minutes or less) it did so with a tremendous bang, like someone had just angrily slammed our room door. We resorted to ear plugs for sleeping. The hotel says it has bathrobes but like other reviewers have noted, we found none. The furniture is supposedly handmade but we found it cheap and flimsy. The bedside radio clock flashed endlessly as it kept coming unplugged. The reason? The socket was at the head of my bed and the mattress pushed against it. Every time I sat on the bed the clock came unplugged. We could not move the plug as it was inserted through the bedside table. To move it we would have had to dismantle the table. The wireless internet costs $8 a day and was not worth a cent. It was a weak signal and dropped my connection every 3 - 5 minutes. The TV worked great, and had a good selection of channels. You will be charged $2 a day for the room safe. It was just a bit too small for my laptop to fit inside, but smaller laptop would likely fit. Our room had no book listing hotel services, no phone book, and no "Do Not Disturb" sign. Small things, but annoying. Our phone was dead after the first day, too. Not sure why, but since we had cell phones we didn't investigate. The bathroom was clean and well-appointed with a bathtub, shower, good water pressure and plenty of hot water. There was a hairdryer and makeup mirror. The towels were of good quality and the amenities are from 'Bed and Bath.' The beds were comfortable, had duvets and 5 pillows each. The coffee maker has no carafe but brews coffee into a coffee cup, using a prepackaged coffee filter the size of a tea bag. It was impossible for me to use my own coffee in this machine. I tried, and only made a mess. There is a bar at the first floor lobby but no evidence of breakfast -- continental or otherwise. There are, of course, many places to get great food nearby. The streetcars that travel St. Charles at the front of this hotel were ruined during Katrina, so were not running. They are going to return, eventually. In any case, Canal Street with it's many bus connections and streetcar is only 1 block away. The biggest problem we faced here, besides the Jazz Fest inflated prices, was lack of customer service. We had reserved a non-smoking room with two beds. When I called the hotel prior to our arrival I was informed they would not and could not guarantee two beds or non-smoking. I was persistant, contacting the Clarion customer service folks who assured me that we were guaranteed the room we had reserved or that the hotel would make other arrangements. The hotel did, eventually, guarantee us a room but I would certainly check before arrival if room type or number of beds was important. The hotel has key cards, and doors have dead bolts with additional fold-over security latches. There were three efficient elevators. We did not see any bell staff during our stay, and no noticable security presence. Non-guests seemed to be wandering the hotel at leisure, and even smoking in the elevators, with no one to challenge them. The so-called mini-bar in our room was actually a dorm sized refrigerator. It was not stocked but the front desk gave us a key so we could use it. The website says fridges are available for rental, but we were told not. In any case, we had what we needed. In short, if this was the only hotel available in the area AND had a good rate I'd recommend it. If you can get a better managed, more guest-friendly hotel go for it.

Reviews.Title: “overall a deal”
Reviews.Author: jamesla
Reviews.Content: after booking the room, i read some reviews and felt i had made a bad choice .but after reading the reviews, i knew what to expect. the hotel is art deco and the emplyees are the same..we were treated very nicely and offered an upgrade to a suite for $15.00 a night extra. the upgrade was a very nice room and larger than our booked room..the location is excellent the street car is behind the hotel and bourbon street is behind the street car...the casino and the river is all in walking distance....and if you can't walk the street cars go north,south,east and west..this is a very modern art deco hotel and the employees match the hotel.....if you are looking for great southern hospitality, sit down with us and have a glass of ice tea ,this is not the place for you. we enjoyed our stay at the royal st. charles and will stay there again....

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights there (be sure to upgrade). Very good value for the price - yes parking is expensive but hotel in convenient so you never have to get car out once it's parked. Rooms are small but very nice - hotel staff was more than helpful. We'll stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Convenience and comfort”
Reviews.Author: cheritoe
Reviews.Content: We stayed in March 2005 for 4 nights. Plenty of room. Comfy bed. A couple of blocks away from the French qtr - an easy walk and far enough away from the madness for some peace and quiet when we wanted it. Right on the streetcar line- made getting around the city easy. Loved the Bath & Body Works products that came with the room. Great service from the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the money.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel on Sunday, April 10, 2005. The Valet service and check in was easy and handled nicely. Our check in was very smooth and we were in the room in Five (5) minutes. The staff was extremely nice and were very professional. The room and bath were very clean. Our Three (3) day stay was without frustration. We walked to all sites, including Harrahs, Bourbon St. Cafe Du Monde, Preservation Hall and the French Market. We recommend the Royal St. Charles to anyone especially those that like to be near most activities. As an added tip, try Felix's Oyster Bar for reasonable raw oysters on the half shell.UUUMMM.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: White_Rock_Sonia
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel Mar 5- 10/05. Found the room to be small - but were expecting that from previous reviews. Location was excellent. Within walking distance of everything including Bourbon St, Royal Ave etc. Staff were friendly and helpful. I have no complaints and would stay there again. The only negative thing I can say is that the one day that I ate breakfast there, there wasn't much left and they didn't have any forks! But it was still a better "deal" than going out to a restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal St. Charles from March 3 thru March 7, 2005 and thought the location was great. The cable car is right outside the door. We walked to Jackson Square, Bourbon Street, Riverwalk, Harrah's, etc. several times each day. The staff was always very friendly and helpful, greeting us everytime we walked thru the lobby. The rooms are clean and nicely decorated, but very small. However, we basically just slept there, so it wasn't much of a problem. The lobby bar was a nice place to recap the days events with our friends and get our game plan ready for the next day before going up to our rooms. If we ever visit New Orleans again, we will definitely return to the Royal St. Charles.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Tiny Rooms But Clean”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you're paying more than $60-80/night for this place then you could probably get something nicer. I had to pay about twice that since there was a conference in town. The one saving grace was that it was clean. The bad points... it is extremely SMALL... and I've stayed at quite a few places in New Orleans, and this is TINY. It was also extremely noisy. The walls are extremely thin and you can hear everything in the hallways. Yes, there is a mandatory $1.95/night safe charge which is ridiculous because no one uses it... and they didn't even mention it when I checked in. The location is great, right outside the French Quarter. A friend of mine stayed at the Astor Crown Hotel and it was nice. I've also stayed at Iberville once and that was larger and nicer as well. The Holiday Inn French Quarter was even smaller than this place. For slightly higher or even the same price if you search right, you could definitely stay in a nice place. Don't get roped in by the word "boutique"... it was not boutiqueish in any way except the size.

Reviews.Title: “A nice clean room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Royal St. Charles from Feb 14 - Feb 20, 2005. Check-in was smooth - the desk clerk was not unfriendly, but merely business-like. I was in a fifth-floor interior non-smoking room, with glass blocks instead of a window - the lack of a view was fine with me, as I spent most of the time at a convention or out on the town with friends. Clean modern room with a king-size bed, TV with remote, iron and ironing board, hair dryer. Good reception for my cell phone - I only used the room phone to call inside the hotel. Bathroom with pedestal sink was a bit small, but clean. No broken items, but the shower head was quite weak. Housekeeping was good, fresh towels each day, and the bed made. I did not eat breakfast at the hotel, which had an extra charge. The fifth floor had a few smoking rooms, and I smelled cigarette smoke in the hallways a couple of times. Otherwise, I didn't see, hear or smell other guests except for a few times in the corridor or at the elevators. The infamous internet booking fee and daily safe fee were extra - yeah, fine, whatever. Overall, my experience was positive, but I still prefer Hampton Inn or Embassy Suites.

Reviews.Title: “big bang for the buck”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading several negative reviews, I was hesitant about staying here but we found the Hotel to be great. It was nice, clean and the location was perfect. This hotel helped to produce a perfect trip to New Orleans. For the price, you cant beat it. Do not hesitate to stay here

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as some reviews suggest”
Reviews.Author: Mini131
Reviews.Content: We were expecting the worst after reading the reviews but were pleasantly surprised. We had a room on 3rd floor that was supposed to be accessible for the disabled, but I'm not sure a wheelchair would have got in. Everything was nice and clean, room was cleaned on daily basis and towels changed. On one day we did not want housekeeping we had a call from the Manager to check everything was ok. Did hear people coming and going occassionally in the corridor and the music playing by the lifts in the middle of the night was alittle annoying but nothing drastic. Safe charges($1.95 per night) and internet booking charge($2.95) was displayed on counter - these were minimal and you would pay for use of a safe in most hotels. On checking out everything was clearly itemised and correct. I made a number of telephone calls via a prepaid phone card and was only charged 75c each time. Perhaps we were just lucky not to have any problems, the staff were fine, a bit laid back, some were friendlier than others, as we found most people were in NOLA. Basically the hotel was ideal for seeing the sights of New Orleans - resting/sleeping and showering/changing. Good location and pleasant foyer that was always manned.

Reviews.Title: “So-so”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent three nights here. Due to price and previous reviews, did not have high expectations. First impression was poor - though one block off Canal Street, the immediate area around the entrance is run-down and neglected. Lobby area is quite presentable, interior halls are well decorated and maintained. We had not expected a large room, so were not surprised to find our 9th floor room to be quite small, with room for only a double bed, although we had requested a king. Furnishings were quite attractive, mostly art deco, and the bathroom, although small, was quite elegant, with modern fixtures. We were aghast by the window - or absence of one! No doubt because of the special web price, we were assigned an inside room, which would normally face the interior well of the building. But the view must have been so inferior that the window panes were thick opaque glass, so we were saved from what must have been a very unsavory view! This caused the room to be quite dark, however, and the 40-watt bulbs in all the lamps didn't help. The room's inside location kept street noises out completely, but the thin walls allowed the slightest noise and conversation to be heard from next door. Service from front desk personel was abysmal in each of the contacts we had with them. Without being actually rude, they were abrupt, unwelcoming, unhelpful, unresponsive, and eye-contact was non-existent. Upon checking in, I asked if breakfast was included in the room rate, as indicated on the website. The answer was a curt "no". I mentioned that the website showed breakfast to be included, and the response was simply a shrug. The doormen, on the other hand were excellent - quickly on the spot to obtain taxis, and load bags for the trip to the airport. Philosophically we accepted you get what you pay for, and for $79 in New Orleans this was it. On the other hand, the location is wonderfully central - a few minutes walking distance to everything, and the St Charles streetcar stops right at the entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Average experience”
Reviews.Author: frozensky
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during November of 2002. The hotels is very decent and clean, but there's nothing unique about it's decor. The room was surprisingly tiny. The good thing is that it's very close to the French Quarter by walking. Expensive parking (all valet), but then again that's true with every hotel there.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a great value! The hotel is just beautiful. The rooms a bit small, but all nicely decorated and cozy. The location is also great. Walking distance from all main New Orleans attractions. And the staff was the best.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Kcarp
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at a lot of hotels in the French Quarter over the last 20 years. This hotel is an average hotel and people that complain about this place you get what you pay for. I picked the hotel because I got a rate of $93 a night for the weekend of Oct. 16 & 17. One thing about the RSC its right in the middle of everything, which is very nice when you donâ€™t feel like walking to far. I did stay in a Suite and the rooms are a little bit bigger, but still small. From the reviews I read on this hotel, I was surprised to find the staff most helpful in everything I asked for. I donâ€™t want to repeat everything everyone else said about this place, but if Bourbon St. is your destination this is the place to stay. Also Superdome is not a bad walk either. If you have any questions feel free to email me at kcarp7@lycos.com

Reviews.Title: “Great City, Terrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just completed a 5 day stay at this hotel. As noted in previous reviews, the "hidden' charges for the room safe seemed inappropriate. Also, in my inquiries prior to the trip, I was quoted a cheaper rate for valet parking and it ended up being higher. Our room had filthy, stained carpeting. The room was so small that it was impossible to fully open the drawers because the end of the bed was too close to the closet door. This hotel was advertised as a 'boutique' hotel so one would expect smaller rooms. Doesn't it make sense to select furniture to fit the room dimensions? NOT HERE !!! I reserved the room via the internet and later learned this hotel had a frequent stay program. I was informed that I could apply our stay to this program. At check-in, my frequent stay number was recorded. During check out, I requested that our statement be updated to acknowledge my membership in their frequent stay program. I was informed that our stay was ineligible PERIOD. There was not one ounce of diplomacy, reasoning or compromise that was offered by the clerk to help me understand the rationale for the miscommunication. Disinterest and rigidity was clearly the presona of the desk staff at checkin/out. We were not expecting the ROYAL treatment based on the room rates. Unfortunately, basic elements of hospitality, helpfulness and cleanliness were clearly not priorities of this establishment. (I stayed at this hotel 2 years ago and found it to be very pleasant. What went wrong??)

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: SDSpartan
Reviews.Content: I was somewhat concerned when I read some of the other reviews before my stay. I would say that most of them were not an accurate reflection of our stay. We had a wonderful room, extemely quiet, on the 7th floor. We did upgrade to a Jr suite for a reasonable premium. The room was lovely, with a large king bed and nice linens. The bathroom was ok, nice, clean but a little on the small side. I know it's a boutique hotel and expected it would be small. The staff was friendly and helpful. The bar was ok but was open only limited hours. They did have nice live music Friday and Saturday nights. The room was very clean and had wonderful windows. The carpets in the hallway were ok - a little worn looking. The location was pretty good. Just one block from Canal street and the French Quarter. I would definately recommend a stay here if you don't need to be right in the Quarter. The downside was that there was not a lot of restaurants/bars open in the evening in the direct vicinity. The only real complaint was that there was not hot water in the shower. Appears that availability of hot water varies. Not really appectable at a supposedly renovated hotel. Other than that we had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alky1229
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, with a great location which can't be beat for the price. To address the people who said the room was small, hence the reason it is called a boutique hotel, that means the rooms are smaller, if you come from a city with some of these hotels you will understand. In regards to the complaints about the staff, the front desk was fine, I don't know why u would have anymore interaction with them other than to check in/out and a question or 2. The bar staff was great the one bartender even reopened the bar at 5:00am when he was closing, for my friends and I and a couple of other people, just because we asked him to. He stayed open till 8:30am, if thats not hospitality then I don't know what is. I've been to Nawlins 4 times in the past year and half and am going back in october, and would stay here again any time.

Reviews.Title: “More trouble than it's worth”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location and fair rooms BUT, front desk staff was pathetic. Hidden charges on safe, internet connection (nethier of which we asked for or wanted) and a bogus long distance charge which was only removed upon proving my cell had national coverage. Charges were really minor from a monetary standpoint but who needs the hassle. The poor attitude was in stark contrast to very friendly shopkeepers and residents.

HotelInfo.Name: Royal St Charles Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 135 St Charles Avenue, New Orleans, LA 70130 (Formerly Clarion Collection Royal St Charles Hotel)
